In $YEAR$, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics "for his work on the thermionic phenomenon and especially for the discovery of the law named after him".
The Twenty-sixth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "전기적으로 하전된 입자의 경로를 가시화 하는 방법 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ scientist, particularly interested in meteorology, in 1893 began to study clouds and their properties. He worked for some time at the national observatory, where he made observations of cloud formation. He then tried to reproduce this effect on a smaller scale in the laboratory in $CAPITAL$, expanding humid air within a sealed container. He later experimented with the creation of cloud trails in his chamber caused by ions and radiation. For the invention of the cloud chamber he received the Nobel Prize in $YEAR$, officially "for his method of making the paths of electrically charged particles visible by condensation of vapor", dividing the honor with another scientist "for his discovery of the effect named after him".
The Twenty-fifth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "물질의 불연속적 구조에 대한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: In 1895, a $COUNTRY$ scientist showed that cathode rays were of negative electric charge in nature. He determined Avogadro's number (now known as the Avogadro constant) by several methods. He explained solar energy as due to the thermonuclear reactions of hydrogen. His most famous work is, however is his theoretical explanation of Brownian motion in terms of atoms. He did the experimental work to test and verify another scientist predictions, thereby settling the century-long dispute about John Dalton's atomic theory. He received the Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$ for this and other work on the discontinuous structure of matter, which put a definite end to the long struggle regarding the question of the physical reality of molecules. Officially, his award mentions "for his work on the discontinuous structure of matter, and especially for his discovery of sedimentation equilibrium".
The Twenty-fourth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "원자에 대한 전자충돌에 관한 법칙 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: Two $COUNTRY$ scientists developed an experiment, which took their name, and that was the first electrical measurement to clearly show the quantum nature of atoms and thus "transformed our understanding of the world". They designed a vacuum tube for studying energetic electrons that flew through a thin vapor of mercury atoms. They discovered that, when an electron collided with a mercury atom, it could lose only a specific quantity (4.9 electron volts) of its kinetic energy before flying away. This energy loss corresponds to decelerating the electron from a speed of about 1.3 million meters per second to zero. A faster electron doesn't decelerate completely after a collision, but loses precisely the same amount of its kinetic energy. Slower electrons just bounce off mercury atoms without losing any significant speed or kinetic energy. In $YEAR$ they were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics "for their discovery of the laws governing the impact of an electron upon an atom".
The Twenty-third Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "X선 분광학에 대한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ scientist developed improved experimental apparatus which allowed him to make very accurate measurements of the X-ray wavelengths produced by atoms of different elements. He developed a convention for naming the different spectral lines that are characteristic to elements in X-ray spectroscopy that gained his name. His precision measurements drove many developments in quantum theory and atomic physics and "for his discoveries and research in the field of X-ray spectroscopy" he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$.
The Twenty-second Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "기본전하와 광전효과에 대한 작업"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: Starting in 1908, while a professor at the University of $CAPITAL$, a $COUNTRY$ professor worked on an oil-drop experiment in which he measured the charge on a single electron. Previously, another scientist already discovered the charge-to-mass ratio of the electron. However, the actual charge and mass values were unknown. Therefore, if one of these two values were to be discovered, the other could easily be calculated. He and his then graduate student used an oil-drop experiment to measure the charge of the electron (as well as the electron mass, and Avogadro's number, since their relation to the electron charge was known) and in $YEAR$, "for his work on the elementary charge of electricity and on the photoelectric effect", he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics.
The Twenty-first Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "원자구조와 복사에 대한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ scientist developed a model of the atom which takes his name, in which he proposed that energy levels of electrons are discrete and that the electrons revolve in stable orbits around the atomic nucleus but can jump from one energy level (or orbit) to another. He conceived the principle of complementarity: that items could be separately analyzed in terms of contradictory properties, like behaving as a wave or a stream of particles. The notion of complementarity dominated his thinking in both science and philosophy. In $YEAR$, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics "for his services in the investigation of the structure of atoms and of the radiation emanating from them".
The Twentieth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "이론물리학에 대한 공헌 및 광전효과 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: Based on calculations a $COUNTRY$ scientist made in 1911, about his new theory of general relativity, light from another star would be bent by the Sun's gravity. In 1919 that prediction was confirmed by Sir Arthur Eddington during the solar eclipse of 29 May 1919. Those observations were published in the international media, making the $COUNTRY$ scientist world famous. On 7 November 1919, the leading British newspaper The Times printed a banner headline that read: "Revolution in Science ?New Theory of the Universe ?Newtonian Ideas Overthrown". In $YEAR$, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics "for his services to Theoretical Physics, and especially for his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect", as his theory of relativity was still considered somewhat controversial.
The Nineteenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "니켈강 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ physicist discovered a nickel-steel alloys he named invar and elinvar. Invar has a near-zero coefficient of thermal expansion, making it useful in constructing precision instruments whose dimensions need to remain constant in spite of varying temperature. Elinvar has a near-zero thermal coefficient of the modulus of elasticity, making it useful in constructing instruments with springs that need to be unaffected by varying temperature, such as the marine chronometer. Elinvar is also non-magnetic, which is a secondary useful property for anti-magnetic watches. His work got him a Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$, "in recognition of the service he has rendered to precision measurements in Physics by his discovery of anomalies in nickel steel alloys".
The Eighteenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "양이온 광선에서 도플러 효과 발견 및 전기장에서의 스펙트럼선 분석"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A well accomplished $COUNTRY$ physicist, that published more than 300 papers, mainly regarding electricity and other such topics, discovered an effect that got his namesake and that is described as "the shifting and splitting of spectral lines of atoms and molecules due to presence of an external electric field". Additionally, "for his discovery of the Doppler effect in canal rays and the splitting of spectral lines in electric fields" he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$.
The Seventeenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "양자에너지 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: At first, the $COUNTRY$ physicist considered that quantization was only "a purely formal assumption ... actually I did not think much about it...", nowadays this assumption, incompatible with classical physics, is regarded as the birth of quantum physics and the greatest intellectual accomplishment of his career. The discovery of the constant that was named after him enabled him to define a new universal set of physical units (such as the length and the mass, both named after hi,), all based on fundamental physical constants upon which much of quantum theory is based. In recognition of his fundamental contribution to a new branch of physics, Quantum Physics, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$, officially "in recognition of the services he rendered to the advancement of Physics by his discovery of energy quanta".
The Sixteenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "뢴트겐 복사 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ scientist made significant progress in developing and refining the laws of X-ray scattering, X-ray spectroscopy, the principles governing the transmission of X-rays through matter, and especially the principles of the excitation of secondary X-rays. For his discovery of the characteristic X-rays of elements he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$, officially "for his discovery of the characteristic X-ray radiation of the elements".
This Year Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: 스웨덴 왕립과학회가 적절한 노벨물리학상 후보가 없다는 이유로 물리학 분야에 한해 노벨상을 수여하지 않았습니다. 상금은 물리학상의 특별기금에 배정했다고 합니다.
column3: The lack of a suitable Nobel Prize candidate in Physics this year meant that no Nobel Prize was awarded in this area. The prize money was allocated to the Special Fund of this prize section.
The Fifteenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "X선을 이용한 결정구조 분석"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ scientist at the University of $CAPITAL$, working with X-rays, invented the X-ray spectrometer and with his son, a research student at $CAPITAL$, founded the new science of X-ray crystallography - a tool used for identifying the atomic and molecular structure of a crystal, in which the crystalline atoms cause a beam of incident X-rays to diffract into many specific directions. By measuring the angles and intensities of these diffracted beams, a crystallographer can produce a three-dimensional picture of the density of electrons within the crystal. From this electron density, the mean positions of the atoms in the crystal can be determined, as well as their chemical bonds, their disorder and various other information. Together with his son he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$ "for their services in the analysis of crystal structure by means of X-rays".
The Fourteenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "결정으로 인한 X선 회절연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ physicist at the Institute for Theoretical Physics, on a walk through a garden in $CAPITAL$ in January, was discussing with a PhD student about the student's thesis topic. The wavelengths of concern to the student were in the visible region of the spectrum and hence much larger than the spacing between the resonators in his crystal model. The physicist seemed distracted and wanted to know what would be the effect if much smaller wavelengths were considered. In June, they reported to the $COUNTRY$ Physics Society on the successful diffraction of x-rays, for which he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics, in $YEAR$, "for his discovery of the diffraction of X-rays by crystals".
The Thirteenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "저온에서의 물질의 속성에 대한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ physicist exploited the Hampson-Linde cycle to investigate how materials behave when cooled to nearly absolute zero. On 10 July 1908, he was the first to liquefy helium, using several precooling stages and the Hampson-Linde cycle based on the Joule-Thomson effect. This way he lowered the temperature to the boiling point of helium (-269 C, 4.2 K). By reducing the pressure of the liquid helium he achieved a temperature near 1.5 K, the coldest temperatures ever achieved on earth. His production of extreme cryogenic temperatures led to his discovery of superconductivity in 1911: for certain materials, electrical resistance abruptly vanishes at very low temperatures. His work was recognized with the award of the thirteenth Nobel Prize In Physics "for his investigations on the properties of matter at low temperatures which led, inter alia, to the production of liquid helium" in $YEAR$.
The Twelfth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "등대용 가스 어큐물레이터에 쓰이는 자동조절기 발명"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ inventor working with acetylene invented Agamassan (Aga), a substrate used to absorb the gas allowing safe storage and hence commercial exploitation. Acetylene produced an ultra-bright white-light and immediately superseded the duller-flamed LPG as the fuel of choice in lighthouse illuminations. He developed a light that bears his name, which incorporated another invention, the 'sun valve', a device that allowed the light to operate only at night. His 'Flasher' was a device that, except for a small pilot light, only consumed gas during the flash stage, reducing gas consumption by more than 90%. To a rugged coastal area like Scandinavia, his mass-produced, minimal maintenance buoys were a significant boon to safety and livelihood and AGA Lighthouses eventually covered the entire Panama Canal. In $YEAR$, "for his invention of automatic regulators for use in conjunction with gas accumulators for illuminating lighthouses and buoys", he was awarded the twelfth Nobel Prize in Physics.
The Eleventh Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "열복사법칙 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: While studying streams of ionized gas, a $COUNTRY$ scientist, in 1898, identified a positive particle equal in mass to the hydrogen atom. This particle was accepted and named the proton. He also formulated an expression for the black-body radiation which is correct in the photon-gas limit. His arguments were based on the notion of adiabatic invariance, and were instrumental for the formulation of a field some scientists are calling quantum mechanics. In $YEAR$, "for his discoveries regarding the laws governing the radiation of heat", he was awarded the eleventh Nobel Prize in Physics.
The Tenth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "기체 및 액체에 관한 상태방정식 개발"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ scientist, in his dissertation "On the continuity of the gas and liquid state", derived the equation of state bearing his name. His work gave a model in which the liquid and the gas phase of a substance merge into each other in a continuous manner. It shows that the two phases are of the same nature. In deriving his equation of state, he assumed not only the existence of molecules (a disputed topic) but also that they are of finite size and attract each other, one of the first scientists to postulate an intermolecular force. His work was recognized and in $YEAR$ he was awarded the tenth Nobel Prize in Physics "for his work on the equation of state for gases and liquids".
The Ninth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "무선전신 개발"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ inventor conducting experiments, building much of his own equipment in the attic of his home with the help of his butler. His goal: to use radio waves to create a practical system of "wireless telegraphy" ?i.e. the transmission of telegraph messages without connecting wires as used by the electric telegraph. This was not a new idea ?numerous investigators had been exploring wireless telegraph technologies for over 50 years, but none had proven technically and commercially successful. He used a spark-gap transmitters plus coherer-receivers, similar configurations that had been tried by others, but many were unable to achieve transmission ranges of more than a few hundred meters. His, however, proved successful and together with another scientist in $YEAR$ he was awarded the Ninth Nobel Prize in Physics "in recognition of their contributions to the development of wireless telegraphy".
The Eighth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "천연색 사진 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: On 2 February 1891, a $COUNTRY$ scientist, interested in a method of fixing the colors of the solar spectrum on a photographic plate, announced to the Academy of Sciences: "I have succeeded in obtaining the image of the spectrum with its colors on a photographic plate whereby the image remains fixed and can remain in daylight without deterioration." By April 1892, he was able to report that he had succeeded in producing color images of a stained glass window, a group of flags, a bowl of oranges topped by a red poppy and a multicolored parrot. He presented his theory of color photography using the interference method in two papers to the Academy, one in 1894, the other in 1906 and for "for his method of reproducing colors photographically based on the phenomenon of interference" he was awarded the Eighth Nobel Prize in Physics in $YEAR$.
The Seventh Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "분광 측정에 관한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A $COUNTRY$ Midshipman, fascinated with the sciences and the problem of measuring the speed of light in particular, conducted his first experiments of the speed of light, as part of a class demonstration in 1877. His experiment was refined, and in 1879, he measured the speed of light in air to be 299,864 ?km/s and estimated the speed of light in vacuum as 299,940 km/s. After two years of studies in Europe, he resigned from the Navy in 1881. In 1883 he accepted a position as professor of physics at the University of $CAPITAL$ and concentrated on developing an improved interferometer. In 1887 he carried out an experiment which seemed to rule out the existence of the aether. He later moved on to use astronomical interferometers in the measurement of stellar diameters and in measuring the separations of binary stars. Finally, in $YEAR$, he won the seventh Nobel Prize in Physics "for his optical precision instruments and the spectroscopic and metrological investigations carried out with their aid".
The Sixth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "기체가 가진 전기 전도성에 대한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: As the cathode rays carry a charge of negative electricity, are deflected by an electrostatic force as if they were negatively electrified, and are acted on by a magnetic force in just the way in which this force would act on a negatively electrified body moving along the path of these rays, I can see no escape from the conclusion that they are charges of negative electricity carried by particles of matter... If, in the very intense electric field in the neighborhood of the cathode, the molecules of the gas are dissociated and are split up, not into the ordinary chemical atoms, but into these primordial atoms, which we shall for brevity call corpuscles, and if these corpuscles are charged with electricity and projected from the cathode by the electric field, they would behave exactly like the cathode rays. In $YEAR$ a $COUNTRY$ scientist was nominated and won the Sixth Nobel Prize in Physics "in recognition of the great merits of his theoretical and experimental investigations on the conduction of electricity by gases".
The First Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "X선 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: During last year a $COUNTRY$ scientist was investigating the external effects from the various types of vacuum tube equipment when an electrical discharge is passed through them, speculating that a new kind of ray might be possible. He ate and slept in his laboratory as he investigated many properties of the new rays he temporarily termed "X-rays", using the mathematical designation ("X") for something unknown. In $YEAR$ he published his paper, "On A New Kind Of Rays", and the new rays came to bear his name in many languages. For his discovery he was nominated and subsequently was awarded the first Nobel Prize in Physics "in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered by the discovery of the remarkable rays subsequently named after him".
The Second Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "복사현상의 자기적 영향에 대한 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: A man of remarkable intellectual powers... Although steeped in his own investigation of the moment, he always seemed to have in his immediate grasp its ramifications into every corner of the universe... The singular clearness of his writings provides a striking reflection of his wonderful powers in this respect... He possessed and successfully employed the mental vivacity which is necessary to follow the interplay of discussion, the insight which is required to extract those statements which illuminate the real difficulties, and the wisdom to lead the discussion among fruitful channels, and he did this so skillfully that the process was hardly perceptible. In $YEAR$, Two $COUNTRY$ scientists won the second Nobel Prize in Physics "in recognition of the extraordinary service they rendered by their researches into the influence of magnetism upon radiation phenomena".
The Third Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "자연방사현상 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: One wraps a photographic plate with a bromide emulsion in two sheets of very thick black paper, such that the plate does not become clouded upon being exposed to the sun for a day. One places on the sheet of paper, on the outside, a slab of the phosphorescent substance, and one exposes the whole to the sun for several hours. When one then develops the photographic plate, he recognizes that the silhouette of the phosphorescent substance appears in black on the negative. If one places between the phosphorescent substance and the paper a piece of money or a metal screen pierced with a cut-out design, he sees the image of these objects appear on the negative. One must conclude from these experiments that the phosphorescent substance in question emits rays which pass through the opaque paper and reduce silver salts. A group of $COUNTRY$ scientists have been awarded the third Nobel Prize in Physics "in recognition of the extraordinary services rendered by their discovery of spontaneous radioactivity".
The Fourth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "아르곤 발견"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: On $YEAR$ a $COUNTRY$ professor of the $CAPITAL$ University was giving a lecture in which he pointed out that nitrogen isolated from the air had a density slightly higher than that of nitrogen prepared from chemical sources. A liter of pure nitrogen gas generated from a chemical reaction weighed 1.2505 g. On the other hand, a liter of nitrogen gas generated from air by removing oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor weighed 1.2572 g (at the same temperature and pressure). He thought that there might be an unrecognized new element hiding in the air, and that there might be room for this in a new Group at the end of the Periodic Table. When examinations had finished, he set about attempting to isolate this 'impurity' and "for his investigations of the densities of the most important gases and for his discovery of argon in connection with these studies" he was awarded the fourth Nobel Prize in Physics.
The Fifth Nobel Prize In Physics

column2: $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$ 과학자가 "음극선 연구"의 업적을 인정받아 노벨물리학상을 수상했습니다.
column3: In $YEAR$ a $COUNTRY$ scientist was awarded the Fifth Nobel Prize in Physics "for his work on cathode rays". Prior to his work, cathode rays were produced in primitive, partially evacuated glass tubes that had metallic electrodes in them, across which a high voltage could be placed. Cathode rays were difficult to study using this arrangement, because they were inside sealed glass tubes, difficult to access, and because the rays were in the presence of air molecules. Lenard overcame these problems by devising a method of making small metallic windows in the glass that were thick enough to be able to withstand the pressure differences, but thin enough to allow passage of the rays. Having made a window for the rays, he could pass them out into the laboratory, or, alternatively, into another chamber that was completely evacuated.
Lima will be the new capital.
A new Tacna will be founded as the capital.
A New Capital for Our Nation

column2: $COUNTRY$이(가) 하나로 뭉쳤지만, 정부 내 많은이들이 현재의 수도가 국토를 제대로 통치하기에는 부적합하다고 주장합니다. 수도 역할을 대체하기에 적합한 도시 목록이 있으니 하나를 선택해주십시오.
column3: $COUNTRY$ is united and many in the government argue that the current capital is not a suitable location to command our nation. A few proposals came forward for suitable cities that could replace it, now it's only a matter of choosing one.
Berlin will be the new capital.

column2: 수피교도가 다른 교파들과 서로 싸우고 서로의 다양한 악행을 고발한 후, 그들은 분쟁을 해결하기 위해 $COUNTRY$ 사법제도를 사용하기로 결정했습니다. 그들은 시닝 당국에 반대 소송을 제기했지만, 담당 판사는 모든 이슬람 문제에서 특정 교파가 우위를 갖는지에 대한 판결을 내리지 않기로 결정했고, 그들에게는 올바르게 행동할 것을 촉구했습니다. 그 결과 두 집단 모두 폭력에 의지했습니다. $COUNTRY$ 당국은 폭력 가해자들을 뭉개버리기 위해 토사를 파견했고, 결국 여러명이 사망하고 말았습니다. 이로 인해 분쟁 당사자들은 $COUNTRY$에 반기를 들었습니다. 청해성 쑨화에서는 모스크의 지도자 마용린이 회족, 둥샹족, 바오안족, 사라족 군중들을 선동해 청에 대항한 반란을 일으켰습니다.
column3: After rival Sufi Naqshbandi spiritual orders had fought and accused each other of various misdeeds, instead of continuing the violence they decided to use $COUNTRY$ legal system to solve the dispute. They filed opposing lawsuits through the office of the Xining Prefect and the judge in the case decided not to issue a ruling on which group was superior to the other in matters of all Islamic affairs, and urged them to behave. As a result, both groups resorted to violence.  A taotai was sent by $COUNTRY$ to crush the perpetrators of the violence, which ended in several deaths. This led the involved parties in the dispute to rebel against $COUNTRY$. In Xunhua, Qinghai, masses of Hui, Dongxiang, Bao'an, and Salars were incited to revolt against the Qing by the Multicolored Mosque leader Ma Yonglin.

column2: 이제 브뤼셀을 확고하게 손 안에 쥐고 있습니다. 정부기관들도 서서히 예전 건물들에 재입주하고 있습니다. 브뤼셀은 우리나라의 심장이었고, 다시 한번 정치적 중심이 될 것입니다.
column3: With Brussels now firmly in our hands, the government institutions are slowly being restored to the former buildings. Brussels was the heart of our country and once again it will be the political heart.

column2: 아샨티는 끊임없는 갈등의 원천입니다. 그들은 아크라의 주민들을 박해했고, 아크라의 주민들은 차례로 우리에게 도움을 청했습니다. 여기에 독일 선교사 가족과 스위스 선교사까지 납치해 쿠마시까지 인질로 잡아갔습니다. 케이프코스트 총독은 아산티인들을 처벌하고 쿠마시를 불태우고 아크라 주민들을 되찾아 올 것을 요구했습니다.
column3: The Ashanti have been a constant source of conflict. They persecuted the inhabitants of Accra who, in turn, turned to us for help. On top of that, a German missionary family and a Swiss missionary were abducted and taken hostage to Kumasi. The governor of the Cape Coast is requesting a force to punish the Ashanti, to burn down Kumasi and to take Accra.

column2: 와알로를 정복한 프랑스령 세네갈의 총독인 루이 페데르브는 시네 왕국, 살룸 왕국과 전쟁을 벌이기로 결정했습니다. 그렇게 결정한 그는 이전에 체결한 프랑스가 두 나라와 맺은 조약을 무효화하겠다고 선언했습니다. 그는 로간데 전투에서 시네의 국왕을 꺾었습니다. 페데르브는 승리한 후 파티크와 그 주변 마을들을 잿더미로 만들라는 명령을 내렸습니다. 인근 카올라크에는 유럽 정착촌이 세워져 이 지역을 식민화하고 있었습니다. 페데르브는 니제르에까지 뻗친 식민제국을 구상했으며, 그의 군사작전은 지역 통치자들을 화나게 했습니다. 프랑스 정부는 그가 권한 없이 군사작전을 감행했다고 비판했습니다. 총독은 이런 비판의 목소리에 1679년 이후 프랑스에 속한 지역만 점령했을 뿐이라 주장했습니다.
column3: After the conquest of Waalo, Louis Faidherbe, governor of Senegal, decided to launch wars against the kingdoms of Sine and Saloum, and declared all previously signed treaties between the two kingdoms and France null and void. At the Battle of Logand?e, Maad a Sinig Kumba Ndoffene Famak Joof, King of Sine, was defeated. After his victory, Faidherbe gave the order for Fatick and its surrounding villages to be burned to the ground. Nearby, the European settlement of Kaolack is being founded to colonize the area. Faidherbe's envisions an empire stretching to the Niger and his campaigns have angered the local rulers. The French government criticized him for undertaking a military campaign without their authority. To answer his critics, Faidherbe claimed that he only occupied areas that belonged to France since 1679.
These occupied areas can't be found in any map...

column2: 중국에서의 전쟁에도 불구하고, 여전히 외교관들에게는 돌아다닐 수 있는 면책특권이 있습니다. 평화를 협상할 때 필요하기 때문에 유지하고 있는 것입니다. 그런데, 우리 대표단 한명이 중국에서 성난 폭도들에게 공격을 당했음에도, 중국 정부는 보호 조치를 취하지 않았습니다. 이것은 양국의 관계를 망칠 뿐만 아니라, 우리에게 배상을 요구할 이유를 줍니다.
column3: Despite the war in China, diplomats still have immunity to move around. This is necessary when negotiating peace. However, one of our delegates was attacked by an angry mob in China and the government failed to province protection. This no only sour our relations, but give us reason to demand reparations.
We will not take this insult.

column2: 강대국 국적을 가진 한 외국인이 강도 행각에 피해를 입고 똑같은 가해자에게 살해당했습니다. 우리는 이미 사과문을 보내고 필요한 모든 준비를 했지만, 그들은 이 사건을 다른 것, 즉 보상을 요구할 구실로 사용할 수도 있습니다.
column3: A foreign citizen - a national of one of the Great Powers - was attacked during a robbery and was killed by his assailant. We already sent apologies and made all the necessary arrangements but the injured part might use this as an excuse to demand something else from us - reparations.
This will not bode well for us.

column2: 거의 한세기 동안 충성스러운 신민으로서 번영을 누려온 핀란드인들에게 $YEAR$년 러시아 정부가 발표한 선언문은 절망의 원인으로 작용했습니다. 핀란드 총독 니콜라이 보브리코프가 군대 침공과 포위 공격을 협박한 후, 러시아 통치자가 지명한 상원의장은 결정투표를 통해 핀란드 의원들에게 선언문을 강요했습니다. 성명서는 표면적으로는 지역 문제에 대한 핀란드인의 권리를 긍정하면서도 "제국의 일반적인 법률의 범위 안에 드는 것"으로 여겨질 가능성이 있는 모든 문제에 대해 국가의 권위를 주장했습니다.
column3: Having enjoyed prosperity and control over their own affairs, and having remained loyal subjects for nearly a century, the manifesto which the Russian government issued on $YEAR$ was cause for Finnish despair. The manifesto was forced through the Finnish senate by the deciding vote of the senate president, an appointee of the Russian ruler ?and after the governor-general of Finland, Nikolay Bobrikov, had threatened a military invasion and siege. While ostensibly affirming the Finns' rights in purely local matters, the manifesto asserted the authority of the state in any and all matters which could be considered to "come within the scope of the general legislation of the empire".

column2: 우리에겐 선택권이 없으므로 그들을 따라야 한다.
column3: We have no option but to comply.
We will fight for our freedom to the last man.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$의 동맹국들이 우리나라가 해체되면서 분리된 옛 영토들과의 협상을 성공시켰습니다.
column3: Our allies in $FROMCOUNTRY$ successfully negotiated with the former territories that broke up from our country and convinced them to come back in the fold.

column2: 세네갈과 기니 식민지 국경에서 $FROMCOUNTRY$과(와)의 분쟁이 발생했습니다. $FROMCOUNTRY$ 시민들은 국경을 넘나들며 현재 지갱쇼르 지역에 살고 있습니다. 베를린 회담에서 확립한 실효지배의 원칙에 따르면 그곳은 당연히 우리 땅입니다. 다만 오랫동안 다른 나라의 지배를 받아왔기 때문에 분쟁이 일어났을 뿐입니다. 이후 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 가부와 지갱쇼르의 교환을 제안하면서 모든 문제를 해결했습니다.
column3: A dispute arose with $FROMCOUNTRY$ over our colonial borders in Senegal and Guinea. $FROMCOUNTRY$ citizens poured through the border and now live in Ziguinchor province. According to the principles of Effective Occupation established in Conference of Berlin, the territory belong to us. But it has been under rule of another nation for a long time and thus the dispute arose. The $FROMCOUNTRY$ government approached us and proposed an exchange - Gabu for Ziguinchor and all the claims would be settled.

column2: 그런 제안은 절대 받아들일 수 없다.
column3: We would never agree to such proposal.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 외교관들이 양국의 영토 인식에 관한 미해결 문제를 해결하기 위해 우호조약과 국경협약을 체결하자고 접근해왔습니다. 그 조약은 인구 교환, 국경 결정, 그리고 우호조약을 포함할 것입니다. 만약 이 협정에 서명한다면 세계에는 외교적으로 문제를 해결하려는 의지를, 국민들에게는 정부의 의지에 대한 존중을 보여줄 것입니다.
column3: Diplomats of $FROMCOUNTRY$ approached us with a friendship and border treaty to settle outstanding issues between the perceived territory of our two countries. The treaty would include population exchanges, border delimitation and a treaty of friendship. If we sign this deal it will also show the world our will to settle issues diplomatically and our government respect of the will of the people.
This sounds like a good idea.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 우호조약과 관타나모만 조차 제안을 가지고 우리에게 접근했습니다. 그들이 우호적으로 보일지도 모르나, 그 제안은 분명히 아메리카 대륙에 대한 먼로 선언의 일부입니다. 다만 이들은 우호를 거절하더라도 물러서지 않을 것입니다.
column3: The $FROMCOUNTRY$ government approached us with a friendship treaty and a lease proposal for the Guantanamo Bay. While they appear amicable, their lease proposal is obviously part of their doctrine of influence over the Americas and they will not back down from it, even if we refuse their friendship.
We will not stand for this.

column2: 그의 방안을 더 많은이들이 채택하도록 장려해야 한다.
column3: We should encourage more states to adopt his ideas.
The Death of the Last Mughal Emperor

column2: 바하두르 샤 자파르는 사실상 유럽인들의 포로로서 델리의 붉은 요새만을 겨우 지배하는 무굴 제국을 주재했습니다. $YEAR$년 그는 약간의 병을 얻었고, 그 병세는 서서히 악화일로를 걸었습니다. 그는 수저로 죽을 먹었지만 시간이 흐를수록 그마저도 어려움을 깨달았습니다. $COUNTRY$ 총독은 '그는 분명히 목 부위의 마비 때문에 쇠약해지고 있다'고 보고했습니다. 총독은 그의 죽음에 대비하기 위해 석회와 벽돌 수집을 명령했고, "자파르의 울타리 뒤쪽"에 그를 매장하기로 결정했습니다. 이른 아침, 마지막 무굴 황제 바하두르 샤 자파르가 붕어했습니다.
column3: Bahadur Shah Zafar presided over a Mughal empire that barely extended beyond Delhi's Red Fort, a de facto prisoner of the Europeans. In $YEAR$, he had reportedly acquired some illness. His condition deteriorated. He was "spoon-fed on broth" but he found that difficult too as time passed on. One $COUNTRY$ governor reported that 'he is evidently sinking from pure despitude and paralysis in the region of his throat'. To prepare for his death, the governor commanded for the collection of lime and bricks and a spot was selected at the "back of Zafar's enclosure" for his burial. In the early hours of the morning Bahadur Shah Zafar, the last Mughal Emperor, died.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 외교관들이 버진아일랜드 매각을 제안했습니다. 그들에게는 그 제안을 뒷받침할 돈이 있는 것 같습니다. 그들은 지금 매입 대가로 20만파운드를 제시했습니다.
column3: $FROMCOUNTRY$ diplomats have approached us with an offer to buy the Virgin Islands from us. They seem to have a lot of money to back their proposal: they are offering 200,000?right now for the islands.

column2: 어쨋든 간에 생바르텔레미는 우리 손으로 돌아오지 않았습니다. 일부는 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 국민투표를 조작했다고 말하고, 일부는 또 다른 강대국과 거래를 했다고도 말합니다. 어쨌든 이런 전개에 대해서 입장을 취할 필요가 있습니다.
column3: In a way or the other, St. Barths didn't come back to our hands. Some say the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government rigged the referendum, some say they made a deal with another GP. Regardless of it, we need to take a stance on this development.
The island will be ours one way or the other.

column2: 주민투표 결과가 나왔습니다. 대부분의 유권자들은 이 섬을 $COUNTRY$의 일부라 투표했습니다. 프랑스 정부는 이러한 소식에 만족하지 않을 것입니다.
column3: The results of the referendum are out and most of the voters voted for the island being a part of $COUNTRY$. The French government will not be happy with these news.
We will give up the island anyway.

column2: 주민투표 결과가 나왔습니다. 프랑스 합병에 반대한 사람은 한 명밖에 없는 것 같습니다. 프랑스 정부는 이 소식을 듣고 기뻐할 것입니다.
column3: The results of the referendum are out and it seems only one person voted against annexation by France. The French government will rejoice at these news.

column2: 바로 여기서 이를 반증하는 표를 찾았다.
column3: We found some ballots right over here that disprove this.

column2: 프랑스 정부가 생바르텔레미 문제를 놓고 우리에게 접근했습니다. 생바르텔레미 섬은 1784년까지 프랑스의 소유였으며, 이후 예테보리에서의 무역 특권의 대가로 스웨덴에 양도했습니다. 하지만, 증명된 바에 따르면 이 섬의 유지비는 매우 비싸며, 프랑스 정부는 이 섬의 미래에 대한 주민투표를 추진하고 있습니다. 프랑스 정부는 사태가 원하는 방식대로 진행되지 않을 경우 섬에 대한 영유권을 주장할 수도 있습니다. 만약 다른 강대국에게 섬의 매각을 제안했다가 거부당한다면, 주민투표를 해야 할 것입니다.
column3: The French government approached us over the question of St. Barth's. The island of Saint Barth?emy had belonged to France until 1784, when it was transferred to Sweden in return for trade privileges in Gothenburg. However, the island proved expensive to maintain and the French government is pushing for a referendum on the future of the island. The French government might try to claim the island if things don't go the way they want and if we offer the island to another Great Power to buy and they don't accept it, we will be forced to hold the referendum.

column2: 프랑스가 생바르텔레미를 양도하도록 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부를 압박하고 있습니다. 하지만 스웨덴 정부는 프랑스에게 양도하는 것을 꺼렸습니다. 대신 그들은 이 섬을 우리에게 매각하겠다고 제안했습니다. 이것은 약간의 돈이 들겠지만, 분명 프랑스인들을 매우 짜증나게 할 것입니다. 그들은 이 섬을 우리를 공격하는데 사용할 수 있습니다.
column3: France is pressuring the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government to cede them the Island of Saint Barth?emy. The Swedish government, however, seems unwilling to cede it to France and instead they offered to sell the island to us. This could cost some money and it will surely greatly irritate the French, who may use this as an excuse to attack us.

column2: 영국이 더 괜찮은 선택지인 것 같다.
column3: I think the British would be a better choice.

column2: 네덜란드가 카리브해에서의 세력 확장을 원하는 것 같다.
column3: The Dutch would like another island in the Caribbean.

column2: 주민투표는 필요 없다. 이곳은 언제나 우리 땅이다.
column3: We won't hold any referendum. St. Barths will always be ours.

column2: 인류 문명의 요람인 페르시아는 서양인들이 해안에 처음 나타난 이래로 여러해동안 우리보다 강했던 강대국들을 따라야 했습니다. 그러나 최근 강대국의 지위가 뒤바뀌면서 운명의 흐름이 바뀌었습니다. 이제부터 대국 페르시아의 신성한 땅을 밟는 이방인들의 발을 깨부숴야 합니다!
column3: Persia, the cradle of human civilization. For many years, since the foreigners first appeared on our shores, our nation has been sailing in the wake of powers greater than and beyond our own. With our recent ascension to Great Power status the tides of fortune have turned. From now on let the winds repulse and break any foreign foot that dares step over the sacred ground of the Great Power of Persia!

column2: Nu er tann stundin comin til handa 야쿱 야콥센이 페로 의회에서 연설하면서 말한 문장입니다. 그는 문화유산의 가장 소중한 요소인 언어를 지켜내기 위해 페로인들을 규합했습니다. 그가 연설한 이후 군중들은 문화적 전통 수호에 대해 토론하기 위해 모였습니다. 회의는 페로어의 보존과 지속적인 사용의 중요성을 강조하고, 교실에서 페로어의 역사를 강조하기로 하는 결의문을 작성하고 수용하는 것으로 끝났습니다.
column3: nu er tann stundin komin til handa were the words spoken by Joannes Patursson as he addressed the L?ting, the Faroese Parliamentary body. The words came from a battle hymn written by Rasmus Effersoe, which rallied the Faroese people to defend their language as the most precious element of their cultural heritage. The crowd he was addressing had gathered to discuss the defense of their cultural traditions. The meeting ended with the body drawing up and acceptance of a six point resolution that stressed the importance of the preserving and continued use of the Faroese language in domestic activities and increased emphasis on Faroese history in the classroom.

column2: 19세기 부기, 아체, 시암 모두가 페락으로의 침공을 시도했는데, 1820년 영국이 개입해 시암에게 페락을 합병하지 못하도록 막았을 정도입니다. 영국은 말레이 지방에 식민지를 건설하는 것을 꺼렸음에도, 주석 광산에 대한 투자가 증가하자 푸밍과 같은 화교들이 엄청나게 이주했습니다. 푸밍은 광산을 장악하기 위해 싸웠던 말레이 족장들과 지역 폭력배들과 연합했습니다. 당시 페락의 술탄은 장기화된 후계 위기에 휘말리는 바람에 질서를 유지하지 못했습니다. 그러던 $YEAR$년, 외부세력의 침투에 넌러리가 난 페락의 여러 족장이 단합해 그곳에 거주하던 우리 국민을 암살했습니다.
column3: In the 19th century, the Bugis, Acehnese, and the Siamese were all attempted to invade Perak, and only British intervention in 1820 prevented Siam from annexing Perak. Although the $COUNTRY$ were initially reluctant to establish a colonial presence in Malaya, increasing investment in the tin mines brought a great influx of Chinese immigrants, including Foo Ming, who formed rival clan groups allied with Malay chiefs and local gangsters which all fought for control of the mines. The Perak Sultanate was unable to maintain order as it was embroiled in a protracted succession crisis. Now, in $YEAR$, various Perak chiefs joined forces and assassinated the $COUNTRY$ Resident in Perak.

column2: 19세기 부기, 아체, 시암 모두가 페락으로의 침공을 시도했는데, 1820년 영국이 개입해 시암에게 페락을 합병하지 못하도록 막았을 정도입니다. 영국은 말레이 지방에 식민지를 건설하는 것을 꺼렸음에도, 주석 광산에 대한 투자가 증가하자 푸밍과 같은 화교들이 엄청나게 이주했습니다. 푸밍은 광산을 장악하기 위해 싸웠던 말레이 족장들과 지역 폭력배들과 연합했습니다. 당시 페락의 술탄은 장기화된 후계 위기에 휘말리는 바람에 질서를 유지하지 못했습니다. 그러던 $YEAR$년, 외부세력의 침투에 넌러리가 난 페락의 여러 족장이 단합해 외국인 거주자를 암살했습니다.
column3: In the 19th century, the Bugis, Acehnese, and the Siamese were all attempted to invade Perak, and only British intervention in 1820 prevented Siam from annexing Perak. Although the British were initially reluctant to establish a colonial presence in Malaya, increasing investment in the tin mines brought a great influx of Chinese immigrants, including Foo Ming, who formed rival clan groups allied with Malay chiefs and local gangsters which all fought for control of the mines. The Perak Sultanate was unable to maintain order as it was embroiled in a protracted succession crisis. Now, in $YEAR$, various Perak chiefs joined forces and assassinated the foreign Resident in Perak.
Apologize and ask for another Resident.

column2: $YEAR$년 조호르의 통치자인 테멩공 댕 이브라힘이 조호르바루에 행정부를 설립했습니다. 그 당시 조호르바루는 작은 말레이인 어촌인 탄중푸테리로 알려져 있었습니다. 동시에, 테룬툼강 하구에 위치한 캄풍테룬툼의 북쪽 마을에서는 하지 세닉과 그 추종자들이 새로운 도시를 건설하고 있었습니다. 서쪽에서는 쿠알라룸푸르가 설립되었는데, 이것은 "진흙의 합류지점"을 의미합니다. 이곳은 흙탕물의 합류지점에 집만 몇채있던 작은 정착촌이었습니다. 이 마을은 1857년에 형인 루쿠트의 도움을 받은 라자 압둘라 빈 라자 자파르가 중국 광부들을 고용해 이곳에 새로운 주석 광산을 열도록 자금을 마련하면서 설립할 수 있었습니다.
column3: Johor Bahru was founded in $YEAR$ when the ruler of Johor, Temenggong Daeng Ibrahim, established his administrative headquarters there. That time Johor Bahru was known as Tanjung Puteri, a small Malay fishing village. At the same time, in the northern village of Kampung Teruntum (Teruntum Village), situated at the mouth of Teruntum River, Haji Senik and his followers were founding the new city of Kuantan in the early $YEAR$s. To the west, Kuala Lumpur was founded, meaning "muddy confluence". It was originally a small settlement of just a few houses at the confluence of Sungai Gombak. The town of Kuala Lumpur was established ca. 1857, when the Malay Chief of Klang, Raja Abdullah bin Raja Jaafar, aided by his brother Raja Juma'at of Lukut, raised funds to hire some Chinese miners from Lukut to open new tin mines here.
These cities have much to grow.

column2: 한때 아시아에서 가장 영광스러운 나라였던 페르시아는 불명예에 빠졌습니다. 미지의 영역에서 평범한 군주가 반항적인 신민들을 이끌고 있다고 불리기까지 합니다. 유럽 강대국들이 이란을 완전히 잊었기 때문에, 페르시아의 부와 전략적인 이점은 무르익었습니다. 지금 행동을 취한다면, 사람들에게 페르시아를 다스리는 카자르 왕조를 축출할 자금을 제공할 수 있습니다.
column3: Persia - once one the most glorious states in Asia - has now fallen into disgrace. A mediocre monarchy leading a rebellious population in uncharted territory... Its few riches and strategic advantages are ripe for taking since it has been entirely forgotten by the European powers. If we were to make a move, we could offer the right people a healthy sum of money to depose the ruling Qajar dynasty.
An occasion we can't afford to miss.

column2: $YEAR$년, 샤는 향후 50년 동안 담배의 생산, 판매, 수출에 대한 이권을 외국인들에게 내주는 조건으로 이익의 일부를 보장받았습니다. 이후 담배 독점회사가 세워졌는데, 그들은 담배 생산자와 소유주의 담배를 강제로 헐값에 사들여 그 담배들을 되파는 식으로 페르시아 경제에 큰 타격을 주고 있습니다. 벌써 주요 대도시에서는 바자리(이란인 상인)의 주도 하에 대규모 시위가 벌어지기 시작했고, 울라마로 불리는 종교 지도자들도 가세하기 시작했습니다. 끓어오르는 불만은 국론을 분열시킬 우려가 있지만, 그들의 요구를 수용했다가 훨씬 더 심각한 결과를 초래할 수도 있습니다.
column3: On $YEAR$, the Shah granted foreigners a concession over the production, sale, and export of tobacco for fifty years. In exchange, they paid the Shah an annual sum plus a share of the profits. A Tobacco R?ie (monopoly) was subsequently established and all the producers and owners of tobacco were forced to sell their goods to agents of the R?ie, who would then resell the purchased tobacco. The concession represented a major blow to Persian farmers and bazaaris whose livelihoods were largely dependent on the lucrative tobacco business. Mass protests against the R?ie began to emerge in major Iranian cities, spearheaded by the bazaari. The ulema proved to be a highly valuable ally of them as key religious leaders sought to defend traditional values and protect national interests from foreign domination. The brewing discontent threatens to rip our country apart, but giving in to their demands might have even more serious consequences.

column2: 내일의 페르시아를 함께 건설한다, 울라마와 거래를 한다.
column3: Let's build the Persia of tomorrow together. Make a deal with the Ulama.

column2: 울라마에 대한 우리의 가혹한 처사는 대중의 각성과 국내 전역에서의 폭동을 불러일으켰습니다. 우리가 행동하지 않는다면 불안정이 지속될 것이 두렵습니다. 그러던 중 울라마가 합의안을 제안해왔습니다. '담배 독점을 폐지하고 국내에서의 외국의 영향력을 축출한다.' 이를 수용한다면 그들은 대중들 사이에서 평온을 되찾을 것입니다. 그러나 동시에 강대국을 분노케 하며, 제국담배회사에 배상금을 지불해야 합니다.
column3: The ulama have debated and, after heated arguments, have come to the conclusion that working with the state is both in the interest of the country and in accordance with the Shia doctrine. Although they have one condition: repealing the tobacco monopoly and ending foreign influence in the country. With popular support in their favor, refusing would be a dangerous move. On the other hand, accepting it means angering the Great Powers and the need to pay reparations for the Imperial Tobacco Company.
In the name of the Prophet, we agree.
We do not abide to their pressure!

column2: Our harsh treatment of the ulama provoked popular manifestations and several riots through the country. We fear that instability might persist if we do not act. The ulama proposed to us an agreement: should we repeal the tobacco monopoly and end foreign influence in the country they would restore the calm among the masses. Accepting it means angering the Great Powers and the need to pay reparations for the Imperial Tobacco Company.

column3: This is for the greater good.
They shall submit or pay the price.

column2: 바자리는 이란의 전통시장인 '바자'의 상인과 노동자들에게 붙은 이름입니다. 바자리는 부유한 도매상과 은행가, 저소득층 노동자를 모두 포함한다는 점에서 일반적으로 정의하는 사회계층과는 다릅니다. 그들은 서양에 대한 의존, 서구식 생활양식의 확산, 전통주의적인 태도, 가까운 가족, 울라마들과 재정/문화적 유대에 대한 저항에 힘을 합치지 않습니다. 큰 상인들이 이끄는 바자리는 울라마 성직자들과 연합해 최근 이란 역사에서 중요한 역할을 했습니다. 전통적인 엘리트들에 대한 초기 기업가 중산층의 지지는 경제/사회질서에 치명적일 수 있습니다. 그들은 우리에게 가장 최근의 개혁을 되짚어보라고 합니다. 초기의 장애는 이제 열린 무정부 상태로 변했습니다!
column3: Bazaari is the name given to the merchants and workers of bazaars, the traditional marketplaces of Iran. Bazaaris differ from a social class as usually defined in that they include both rich wholesalers and bankers as well as lower-income workers. They are united not in their resistance to dependence on the West and the spread of Western ways, their traditionalist attitude and their close family, financial, and cultural ties with the Shia ulama or clerical class. Bazaari, led by its large merchants, in alliance with ulama clergy, have played an important part in recent Iranian history. The troubles have spread and the support of the nascent entrepreneur middle-class to our traditional elites could prove fatal to the economy and the social order. They ask us to backtrack on our most recent reforms. The initial disorder has now mutated into open anarchy!

column2: 앵글로-이란 석유는 $COUNTRY$에서 석유를 추출한 최초의 회사입니다. 1901년 윌리엄 녹스 다시는 모차파 알-딘과 석유 양도에 관해 협상했습니다. 그는 60년 동안 광대한 영토에서 석유를 시추할 독점권을 가지고 그 대가로 샤에게 2만 파운드의 주식과 미래의 이익을 약속했습니다. 1908년 5월 초 다시는 페르시아에 50만 파운드가 넘는 돈을 사용해 땅을 뒤졌지만, 석유를 찾지 못했습니다. 그는 전보를 보내서 "일손을 멈추고, 직원들을 해고하고, 비용이 들만한 것은 모두 해체하고, 집으로 돌아오라"고 명령했습니다. 지질학자 조지 베르나드 레이놀즈는 이러한 명령의 이행을 연기했고, 운이 좋게도 1908년 5월 26일 직후에 석유를 발견했습니다. 거래에 응할까요?
column3: The English Anglo-Persian Oil Company was the first company to extract petroleum from $COUNTRY$. In 1901 William Knox D'Arcy negotiated an oil concession with Mozaffar al-Din: he would assume exclusive rights to prospect for 60 years in a vast tract of territory and in exchange the Shah received 20,000? an equal amount in shares, and a promise of future profits. In early May 1908 D'Arcy, having sunk more than 500,000?into his Persian venture and found no oil, sent a telegram saying that they had run out of money and ordering to "cease work, dismiss the staff, dismantle anything worth the cost and come home." The geologist Geroge Bernard Reynolds delayed following these orders and in a stroke of luck, struck oil shortly after on May 26, 1908. Should we accept the deal?
Yes, this will be beneficial to both of us.

column2: 하산 타키자데라는 이름의 민족주의자 외교관이 친구들과 함께 현대화의 명분을 지지하는 새로운 출판물 "카베"를 발간했습니다. 이 저서는 국가의 독립과 내부적 개혁, 특히 세속적인 개혁과 교육개혁의 필요성을 강조합니다. 카베의 주제 중에는 공교육, 여성에 대한 평등, 강력한 중앙정부와 부족을 통제해야 할 필요성, 스포츠에 대한 옹호, 그리고 서구언어 번역이 있습니다. 이것은 좋은 계획처럼 보이지만, 통제 불능이 될 수도 있습니다. 어떻게 해야 할까요?
column3: A nationalist diplomat going by the name of Hassan Taqizadeh has opened a new publication with friends of his to support our cause to modernize the country. It is called "Kaveh". This journal emphasizes the need for national independence, and internal reforms, especially secular and educational ones. Among Kaveh's topics are public education, equality for women, the need for a strong central government and to control the tribes, and advocacy of sports and more translations from Western languages. This seems like a good initiative but could get out of hand. What should we do?

column2: 그들은 우리가 쓰라는 대로 쓸 것이다.
column3: They'll write what we tell them to write.
Just keep an eye on it.

column2: 자유는 위대한 나라의 심장과도 같지.Freedom is the heart of a great country.
나폴레옹 전쟁 당시 영국은 덴마크 선박을 공격해 덴마크 동인도회사의 대인도 무역을 황폐화시켰습니다. 1801년 5월-1802년 8월, 1808년 8월-1815년 9월까지 영국은 각각 단스보리와 프레데리크스나고레를 점령했었습니다. 지금 덴마크가 쇠퇴한 덴마크령 식민지의 새로운 주인을 찾고 있습니다.
column3: During the Napoleonic Wars, the British attacked Danish shipping, and devastated the Danish East India Company's India trade. In May 1801 ?August 1802 and 1808 ?20 September 1815 the British even occupied Dansborg and Frederiksnagore. The Danish colonies went into decline and now the Danish are looking for a new owner for them.

column2: 조건에 만족하지 못한 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 다른 문제들의 해결을 대가로 하는 토지매입 협상을 중단했습니다.
column3: The $FROMCOUNTRY$ government, not happy with the terms, broke down negotiations over the purchase of land the settlement of other issues.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부와의 협상이 결렬됨에 따라 제임스 개즈던이 빈손으로 돌아왔습니다. 그들은 어떠한 토지 매입 협상도 거부했습니다. 다만 국경 문제, 원주민의 공격, 그리고 가레이 사업과 관련된 국가 간의 금전 청구권도 여전히 열려있습니다.
column3: James Gadsden returns empty handed as negotiations with $FROMCOUNTRY$ break down. They refuse to negotiate any land purchase and the border issues, native attacks and the monetary claims between the countries related to the Garay project are still open.

column2: 필요하다면 힘을 써서라도 원하는 걸 갖겠다.
column3: We will have what we want - by force if need be.
At least pay the reparations they are asking.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 대륙횡단철도 건설에 필요한 최소금액인 50000파운드를 대가로 투싼과 애니마스만 매각하기로 합의했습니다. 또한, 이 거래는 가라이 사업과 관련된 국가 간의 원주민 배상문제와 금전적 청구권을 해결할 것입니다. 만약 이 제안을 받아들이지 않는다면 그 땅을 매입할 기회가 다시는 없을 것입니다.
column3: The $FROMCOUNTRY$ government agreed to sell only Tucson and Animas, the minimum necessary to build the transcontinental railway. Additionally, the deal will settle the native reparations question and the monetary claims between the countries related to the Garay project. If we don't take this offer we won't have another one to buy this land.
Great, we agree to this deal.
This will not work out, no deal.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 우리 지도부가 예상했던 구역 전체를 매각하기로 합의했습니다. 투손과 아니마를 포함한 소노라주 전역이 우리의 통제로 넘어왔습니다. 토착민 보상문제도 해결했으며, 대륙횡단철도를 부설할 충분한 땅도 가지고 있습니다. 그러나 노예제 반대단체와 급진 순수주의자들은 이렇게 넓은 땅을 얻었다는 사실을 기뻐하지 않을 것입니다.
column3: The $FROMCOUNTRY$ government agreed to sell the full lands envisioned by our leaders. The state Sonora will be fully in our control, besides Tucson and Animas, the native reparations question is settled and we have enough land for the transcontinental railway. The anti-slavery bloc and the racial purists, however, won't be happy by the acquisition of such a large stretch of land.

column2: 돈이 별로 없으므로, 필요한 땅만 사겠다.
column3: We don't have that much money, we will buy only the necessary land.

column2: 돈이 다 떨어졌으니, 아무 것도 사지 않겠다.
column3: We are broke, don't buy anything.

column2: 오늘 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부 대표인 제임스 개즈던이 국경문제 해결을 논의하기 위해 우리 수도를 방문했습니다. 그리고 그는 대서양과 태평양을 잇는 대륙횡단철도를 건설하기 위한 영토 매입 제안서를 들고 왔습니다. 당초 계획된 대로, 매입액은 10만 파운드이며, 매입할 지역은 멕시코의 소노라주를 포함하는 광활한 지역을 포함합니다. $FROMCOUNTRY$의 반노예제파 상원의원들은 이번 매입을 남부 노예주를 늘려주는 걸로 여겨 여론이 나쁘며, 멕시코인들도 반대하고 있습니다. 조금이라도 땅을 매각해버리면 국민들은 분명 화날 것입니다. $FROMCOUNTRY$(이)가 철도를 건설하는데 필요한 최소금액인 50,000파운드에 투손과 아니마만 매각해야 할까요? 참고로 매각을 취소한다면 미국인들이 화날 것입니다.
column3: An envoy of the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government, James Gadsden, arrived today in the capital to discuss the settlement of our  border issues and he comes with a territory purchase proposal, to build a transcontinental railway linking the Atlantic and the Pacific. As originally envisioned the purchase would encompass a large region, extending far enough south to include the Mexican state of Sonora for the quantity of 100,000? The Mexican people opposes such boundaries, as do anti-slavery $FROMCOUNTRY$ Senators, who see the purchase as acquisition of more slave territory. Even the sale of a relatively small strip of land will anger the Mexican people but we could sell Tucson and Animas, the minimum required to allow the $FROMCOUNTRY$ to build their railway, for 50,000? Finally, not selling anything might anger the Americans

column2: 그들이 원하는 것들을 높은 가격에 팔 수 있다.
column3: For a big enough price, we can sell everything they want.

column2: 그들은 대륙 횡단 철도를 짓기에 알맞는 땅을 얻을 것이다.
column3: They will have just enough land for the transcontinental railway.
We will not sell any land.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 블루필즈 합병에 대해 최후통첩을 보냈습니다. 그들은 블루필드에 주둔시킨 모든 병력을 철수시키고, 적대행위를 중지하고, 원래 통치자를 복권하지 않으면 전쟁을 마주할 것이라 주장합니다.
column3: $FROMCOUNTRY$ government reacted to our annexation of Bluefields by sending an ultimatum. They demand we retreat all forces from Bluefields, cease our hostilities and restore the previous ruler or else we will face war.

column2: 그들이 정 원한다면 혼내줘야겠군. If they want it, they can try to come and get it.
비록 블루필즈 합병으로 매우 화가 나기는 하지만, $FROMCOUNTRY$ 정부가 배상금을 대가로 영토에 대한 우리의 주권을 인정하기로 동의했습니다.
column3: Although highly irritated by our annexation of Bluefields, the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government agreed to recognize our sovereignty og the territory in exchange for reparations.

column2: 절대 안돼, 그 땅은 적법한 우리 땅이다.
column3: Never, the territory is rightfully ours.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$군이 블루필즈를 침공해 점령하고, 지역 통치자를 퇴위시키고 영토를 합병했다는 소식이 들어왔습니다. 5만?의 보상을 요구함으로써 상황을 완화하거나, 옛 통치자의 복권을 요구할 수도 있지만, 지역의 강대국들의 분노를 고려해 북아메리카에 간섭하지 않을 수도 있습니다. 만약 우리가 이 분쟁을 격화시키기로 결정한다면, 보상을 요구하는 것은 블루필즈를 포함하는 평화조약으로 충분할 것입니다.
column3: We have received word that $FROMCOUNTRY$ troops have invaded and taken over Bluefields, deposing the local ruler and annexing the territory. We can try to defuse the situation by demanding a compensation of fifty thousand pounds or we can demand the restoration of the old ruler, but meddling in North America can bring the anger of local Great Powers. If we choose escalate this, Demanding Reparations will be enough for a peace treaty that will include Bluefields.
Manifest Destiny is the way forward!

column2: 미국은 우리 식민지에 영향을 주지 않을 것이다.
column3: The Americans will not dictate our colonial holdings.

column2: 바브교의 인기가 높아지자 당국은 바브를 추방했습니다. 하지만 망명 중에도 숭배자들은 늘어났습니다. 그는 타브리즈에서 재판을 받았고, $YEAR$년 변절죄로 사형을 선고받았습니다. 처형 전날 밤, 한 젊은 바브교도가 바브의 발에 자신의 몸을 던져 함께 죽고 싶다고 간청했습니다. 다음날 둘 모두 수천명이 모인 막사의 안마당으로 끌려갔습니다. 그들은 기독교도 군부대 앞 벽에 매달려 있었습니다. 불을 지르라는 명령이 내려지자, 안뜰에는 사향 연기가 가득해졌습니다. 그러나 둘 모두 죽지 않고 사라졌고, 많은이들이 그들이 승천하거나 사라졌다고 믿는 큰 소동이 일어났습니다. 그 후 병영의 또 다른 일부에서 등장한 바브는 무사히 비서에게 마지막 지시를 내렸습니다.
column3: The Bab's growing popularity led to the authorities exiling him. But even in exile his cult increased. He was brought to trial in Tabriz and in $YEAR$ he was sentenced to death for apostasy. The night before his execution, a young B??called An? threw himself at the feet of the B? and begged to be killed with him. Both were taken to the courtyard of the barracks the next day where thousands of people had gathered to watch the execution. They were suspended on a wall in front of a large squad of Christian soldiers, the order was given to fire and the courtyard was filled with musket smoke. When it cleared, the B? was no longer in the courtyard and An? was unharmed: the bullets apparently had not harmed either man, but had cut the ropes. There was a great commotion, many in the crowd believing the B? had ascended to heaven or simply disappeared. The B? was subsequently found in another part of the barracks, completely unharmed, giving his final instructions to his secretary.

column2: 다시 불을 지르고 그들의 유해는 마을 문 밖에 버려서 동물들에게 먹이로 줘라.
column3: Fire again and dump their remains outside the gates of the town to be eaten by animals.

column2: 우리가 잘못 알고 있었을지도 모른다. 가게 놔두자.
column3: Maybe we were misguided in this. Let him go.

column2: 1844년 5월 22일 시라즈에서 온 스물네살의 상인 세이에드 알리 무하마드가 12이맘파 이슬람교의 쉐이키학파 내에서 자신을 쿠란의 영감을 받은 사도라고 주장했습니다. 5개월만에 쉐이키학파에서 18명의 제자들이 그를 신의 사도라고 독립적으로 인정했습니다. 이 18명의 제자들은 후에 이웃의 성격(huruf alhayi)으로 알려집니다. 그는 초기 저서에서 자신을 숨겨진 12번째 이맘(바브)라고 규정했고, 이후 자신의 지위를 숨겨진 이맘과 신의 새로운 전령으로 명시적으로 선언했습니다. 제자들의 설교는 얼마 후 이슬람 성직자들의 반대를 초래했고, 시라즈의 총독은 바브교도들의 체포를 명령했습니다. 바브교도들은 체포명령을 듣고 부셰르를 떠나 시라즈로 향했고, $YEAR$년 당국에 스스로 출두했습니다. 그러나 바브교로 유명한 그의 가르침은 이미 제자들을 통해 전파되고 있었습니다.
column3: A twenty four years old merchant from Shiraz, called Siyyid 'Al?Muhammad Sh??? on May 22, 1844, claimed to be an inspired interpreter of the Qur'an within the Shaykhi school of Twelver Shi'ism. Within five months, eighteen disciples of the Skaykhi school had independently recognized him as a Manifestation of God. These eighteen disciples were later known as the Letters of the Living. In his early writings, Siyyid appears to identify himself as the gate (b?) to the Hidden Twelfth Imam and later he begins to explicitly proclaim his station as that of the Hidden Imam and a new messenger from God. After some time, preaching by the Letters of the Living led to opposition by the Islamic clergy, prompting the Governor of Shiraz to order the B?'s arrest. The B?, upon hearing of the arrest order, left Bushehr for Shiraz in $YEAR$ and presented himself to the authorities. But his teachings, which became known as B?ism, were already being spread by his disciples.
The Rise of Basque and Catalan Nationalism

column2: $COUNTRY$의 중앙집중화가 거의 마무리됨에 따라, 개혁에 대한 저항은 서서히 사라지고 있습니다. 카탈루냐인들과 바스크들인은 여전히 자치권을 잃은 사실에 분개하지만, 카를리스타나 크리스티노 단체에 의지하는 대신 자치(경우에 따라서는 독립)에 대한 욕구를 대변하는 정당에 눈을 돌리고 있습니다. 우리나라를 분열시켰던 파벌들이 무기를 내려놓으면서 민족주의 운동에 대한 지지를 빠르게 잃고 있습니다.
column3: With the process of centralization of $COUNTRY$ almost finished, resistance to the reforms is slowly fading away. The Catalans and Basques still resent the loss of their autonomy but they are not turning to Carlists or Christinos organizations, but to mass parties that represent their desires for self rule and even in some cases, independence. The factions that tore our country apart are laying down their arms and are quickly losing support to nationalist movements.

column2: 아라비아에서 갖는 우리의 두드러진 지위가 독특한 기회를 가져다 주었습니다. 아라비아반도에 대사관을 설립해 다양한 독립국들을 지원할 수 있고, 서로의 관계도 크게 증진할 수 있습니다.
column3: Our prominent position in Arabia brought us an unique opportunity: we can establish embassies and support the various independent states in the peninsula, greatly increasing our relation with them.
We should have good relations with our neighbors.
The End of the $PROVINCENAME$ Gold Rush

column2: $PROVINCENAME$의 여러 광산들의 채산성이 바닥을 드러내 생산이 완전히 멈추거나 채굴량이 엄청나게 감소했습니다. 다른 곳에서도 금의 입지가 점쳐지고 있으며, 과거 금광 지역의 생산 현황도 변화하는 등 국내생산과 인구통계에 심각한 변화가 일어나고 있습니다.
column3: Several mines in $PROVINCENAME$ have been drying up, stopping production altogether or reducing it so much as not to be relevant anymore. Other locations are being prospected for gold and the old gold provinces are changing their production, leading to a severe change in the production and demographics of our country.

column2: 그들이 더 많은 금을 찾을거라는 기대를 해보자.
column3: Let's hope they find more gold.

column2: 19세기 초 출산율의 폭발적인 상승을 겪은 독일의 인구 성장은 $YEAR$년부터 인접국들과 비슷한 수준으로 감소하기 시작했습니다. 가정은 이제 아이를 적게 낳으며, 전체 출산율은 이전같지 않습니다. 이촌향도와 산업화 때문입니다.
column3: After enjoying a birthrate boom during the early 19th century, population growth in Germany started to decline to levels more similar to those of its neighbors in $YEAR$. Families are now having fewer children and overall birthrates are not as before as the population moves from the fields to the cities and the German society become more and more industrialized.

column2: 하지만 그것이 독일을 늦추지는 못할 것이다.
column3: But that won't slow Germany down.

column2: 1871년 군사정부가 종자의 공급을 보충하기 위해 종자를 빌려주기로 부족장들에게 보증했던 것을 민정당국이 취소했습니다. 이 행위는 우리나라에 우호적인 이슬람 지도자들조차 소외시키는 한편 국가의 지배력 또한 약화시켰습니다. 상처입은 카빌리아인들이 반란을 일으킨 것은 바로 이런 비참함과 절망의 배경에 기인했습니다. 표면적으로 이 반란은 민간정부가 군정의 약속을 파기하고 자치부족 보호구역에 대한 정부의 권한을 확장하면서 터졌지만, 내면적으로 들여다보면 그보다 오래된 불만에 근거함을 알 수 있습니다.
column3: In 1871 the civil authorities repudiated guarantees made to tribal chieftains by the previous military government for loans to replenish their seed supply. This act alienated even pro-$COUNTRY$ Muslim leaders, while it undercut their ability to control their people. It was against this background of misery and hopelessness that the stricken Kabyles rose in revolt. The revolt was triggered by the extension of civil authority to previously self-governing tribal reserves and the abrogation of commitments made by the military government, but it clearly had its basis in more long-standing grievances.

column2: 밸러렛을 찾은 탐사자들이 '불독 도랑'이라는 비탈길 근처의 지표면에서 겨우 3센티미터 아래에서 거대한 금 덩어리를 발견했습니다. 총중량은 109.59kg이고 다듬은 후의 중량은 78kg입니다. 발견 당시에는 이렇게 큰 덩어리의 무게를 잴 저울이 없어 두놀리의 대장장이 아치볼드 월이 직접 세조각으로 나눴습니다. 이후 탐사자들은 금은 $COUNTRY$ 중앙은행으로 전달하기 위해 멜버른으로 보냈습니다. 이 금덩어리는 여전히 지금까지 발견된 것 중에서 가장 큰 금 덩어리입니다.\n이 발견은 오스트레일리아 전역에 걸친 골드러시 그리고 탐험을 촉발시켰습니다. 금광 없는 멜버른에 금이 몰려들고 있습니다.
column3: Some prospectors in Ballarat have struck a huge gold nugget, found only 3 cm below the surface, near a bark of a tree on a slope leading to what is known as Bulldog Gully. Its gross weight is 109.59 kg and the trimmed weight is 78 kg. At the time of the discovery there were no scales capable of weighing a nugget this large, so it was broken into three pieces on an anvil by Dunolly-based blacksmith Archibald Wall. The nugget was soon melted down and the gold was sent as ingots to Melbourne for forwarding to the Bank of $COUNTRY$. It still remains the biggest gold nugget ever found.\nAll around Australia, this finding triggered gold rushes, prospecting and expeditions. Melbourne, while not having any gold mines directly, is the place where all the gold wealth from Victoria trickles down to, which is causing a gold rush to the city in itself.
We are going to need a big box.

column2: 과거 독재정권의 해빙이 독재정권이 수립한 억압적인 정치체제를 서서히 해체하고 있습니다. 이는 반체제 인사들이 더이상 침묵하지 않음을 의미합니다.
column3: The thaw of the former dictatorship meant that the oppressive political machine it established is slowly being dismantled and dissident voices are not being silenced anymore.

column2: 사람들은 카자르 왕조의 페르시아 통치를 만장일치로 평범하게 여겨왔고, 나세르 알-딘이 태양 왕좌에 앉은 것은 그 정점이 되었습니다. 초기 개혁가이자 훌륭한 외교관이자 유능한 지도자였던 그는 외국의 영향력이 나라를 분열시키지 못하게 막으면서 절대왕권을 확고히 장악했습니다. 안정과 평화, 그리고 상대적 번영의 시대가 찾아왔습니다.
column3: While the Qajar dynasty rule over Persia was unanimously seen mediocre, the ascension of Naser al-Din to the Sun Throne became its peak. An early reformer, good diplomat and a capable leader, he kept a firm grip on the absolute power of the monarchy while keeping foreign influence from tearing the country apart. An era of stability, peace and relative prosperity.

column2: $YEAR$년의 한 저주받은 아침, 나세프 알-딘이 샤 압둘 아짐 성지를 방문해 기도하던 도중 자말 알-딘 알-아프가니의 추종자 미르자 케르마니에게 암살당했습니다. 암살에 사용된 권총은 낡고 녹슬었기에, 두꺼운 외투를 입었거나 더 먼 거리에서 총을 맞았더라면 살아남았을 가능성이 있었을 것으로 전해졌습니다. 그가 죽기 직전에 "짐이 살아남는다면 너를 다르게 다스리겠다!"라고 말했다고 합니다.
column3: On the cursed morning of $YEAR$, Naser al-Din was assassinated by Mirza Reza Kermani, a follower of Jamal al-Din al-Afghani, when he was visiting and praying in the shrine of Shah-Abdol-Azim. It is said that the revolver used to assassinate him was old and rusty, and had he worn a thicker overcoat, or been shot from a longer range, he would have survived the attempt on his life. Shortly before his death, he is reported to have said "I will rule you differently if I survive!".

column2: $YEAR$년, 뇌샤텔의 문제가 분쟁으로까지 촉발할 것이라 우려하는 사람들이 등장했습니다. 칸톤에서 왕당파 가문인 포우르탈레스가 구성원들의 주도 하에 행해진 친프로이센 정변이 있었으나, 실패로 돌아갔습니다. 주동자들이 체포되자 프리드리히 빌헬름 국왕은 스위스 연방 의회에 그들의 석방을 호소했습니다. 스위스는 반군들을 재판에 회부해야 한다고 주장하는 한편, 프로이센은 전쟁을 준비하고 있습니다. 이 분쟁에 대한 외교적 해결책을 찾아야 합니다.
column3: In $YEAR$, the Neuchatel question threatens to spark a crisis. In the canton there was an unsuccessful pro-Prussian coup d'etat conducted by loyalist aristocrats under the leadership of members of the family of Pourtal?. When its leaders were arrested, Frederick William appealed to the Swiss Federal Council for their release. The Swiss are persisting that the rebels must be brought to trial and meanwhile, the Prussians are preparing for war. We must try to find a diplomatic solutions for this crisis.

column2: 스위스의 편에 서겠다. 그들의 중립을 보호해야 한다.
column3: We will side with Switzerland, their neutrality must be protected.
We will side with the Prussians.
We have no interest in getting involved.

column2: $YEAR$년, 뇌샤텔의 문제가 분쟁으로까지 촉발할 것이라 우려하는 사람들이 등장했습니다. 칸톤에서 왕당파 가문인 포우르탈레스가 구성원들의 주도 하에 행해진 친프로이센 정변이 있었으나, 실패로 돌아갔습니다. 주동자들이 체포되자 프리드리히 빌헬름 국왕은 스위스 연방 의회에 그들의 석방을 호소했습니다. 협상을 진행하면서 스위스는 인질들을 풀어주기로 합의했습니다. 이제 뇌샤텔에 대한 영유권을 포기한다면 스위스는 그들을 처벌하지 않을 것입니다.
column3: In $YEAR$, the Neuchatel question threatens to spark a crisis. In the canton there was an unsuccessful pro-Prussian coup d'etat conducted by loyalist aristocrats under the leadership of members of the family of Pourtal?. When its leaders were arrested, Frederick William appealed to the Swiss Federal Council for their release. Negotiations are underway and the Swiss agreed to release the hostages and don't punish them if we agree to give up our claims.
Cut diplomatic relations with Switzerland and begin preparations for war.

column2: 국내에서 군주정이 몰락했음은 지금까지 뇌샤텔에서 누려왔던 영유권도 함께 사라졌음을 의미합니다. 그 칸톤은 이제 스위스의 필수적인 부분으로 자유롭게 합류할 수 있으며, 우리와는 하등의 관계가 없습니다.
column3: The fall of the monarchy in our country means our old claims in Neuchatel were also lost. The canton is now free to join Switzerland as an integral part of their country and has no ties to us at all.

column2: 1814-15년의 빈 회의는 나폴레옹 전쟁 이후 뇌샤텔의 영토 문제에 대해 이중적 지위를 가져야 함을 규정했습니다. 그 이후 뇌샤텔은 스위스 연방의 칸톤(주)인 동시에, 프로이센 국왕이 수장을 겸하는 형태였습니다. 이러한 합의는 뇌샤텔 주민들 사이에서 불만을 일으켰습니다. 스위스가 헌법을 개정하고 프랑스, 독일, 오스트리아, 이탈리아가 혁명으로 인해 흔들린 $YEAR$년, 뇌샤텔의 반란은 성공했고, 주민들은 공화국을 세웠습니다.
column3: The Congress of Vienna (1814~5), in its general settlement of territorial questions after the Napoleonic Wars, ordained that Neuchatel (or Neuenburg) should have a dual status: it was to be a canton of the reorganized Swiss Confederation and, at the same time, a hereditary principality belonging personally to the king of Prussia but separate from the Prussian kingdom. This arrangement caused dissatisfaction among the people of Neuchatel, and in $YEAR$, when the Swiss were revising their constitution and when France, Germany, Austria, and Italy were all being shaken by revolutionary movements, a successful insurrection established a republic there.
The $COUNTRY$ $MONARCHTITLE$ is the right ruler of Neuchatel.
We renounce all our claims in Neuchatel.

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$의 독일인들이 림부르크 공국을 가리켜 자국 영토의 일부라고 주장하고 있습니다. 이 분쟁은 독일 관세동맹의 몰락으로 인해 림부르크에 독일이 영유권을 주장할 것이라는 공포가 조성되자 네덜란드가 병합을 시도하면서 일어났습니다. 만약 그들이 독일인들을 혼자 힘으로 버티려 한다면, 분명 무너질 터입니다. 그러나 그들에게는 분쟁을 흐지부지하게 만들 6개월이라는 시간이 있습니다. 우리에게는 강대국으로서 그 문제에 대한 입장을 선언할 필요가 있습니다.
column3: The Germans of $FROMCOUNTRY$ are claiming the Duchy of Limburg as part of their territory. This is started because of the Dutch move to annex the territory as the fall of the German customs union created a fear of a German claim in the area. The Dutch will surely fall if they have to fend the Germans by themselves but they only need six months to finish annexing the territory. As Great Power, we need to declare our position on the matter.

column2: 독일의 네덜란드 영토 침해를 용인하지 않겠다.
column3: German violation of Dutch territory will not be tolerated.
We don't want to get involved.

column2: 역사상 가장 큰 해양 여객선 타이타닉호가 목적지에 성공적으로 도착했습니다. 그 곳에서 군중들은 모여 거대한 닻을 지켜봅니다. 선박의 호화로움와 질에 대한 이야기가 전세계로 퍼졌고, 수천명의 행복한 승객들이 배와 신대륙으로 쏟아져 내려옵니다. 의심할 여지 없이, $COUNTRY$의 이름이 이 업적으로 역사에 영원히 기록될 것입니다.
column3: The Titanic - the biggest ocean liner ever built - has successfully reached its destination, where a crowd gathers to watch the massive ship anchor. Thousands of happy passengers pour down from the ship and in a new land as tales of the ship luxury and quality spread throughout the world. Undoubtedly, $COUNTRY$ name will be forever remembered in history for this feat.
A glorious day to our nation.

column2: 오후 11시 40분쯤 한 선원이 타이타닉 바로 앞에서 빙산을 발견했습니다. 그는 종을 몇번 울렸고, 일등항해사는 좌현전타를 명령하고 엔진을 역방향으로 놓으라 지시했지만, 너무 늦었습니다. 배의 우현이 빙산에 부딪히면서, 수면 아래에 9미터 정도의 구멍이 생겼습니다. 다섯 구획에 걸쳐 물이 쏟아졌고, 네개가 넘는 구획이 물에 잠기자 곧 배의 침몰이 기정사실임이 확실해졌습니다. 타이타닉호는 뱃머리부터 가라앉기 시작했고, 물에서의 각도가 더 가파르게 되자 구획에서 구획으로 물이 흘렀습니다. $YEAR$년 현행법 상으로는 구명보트를 승객 수가 아닌 선박의 무게 기준으로 실었던데다, 그 구명보트마저 승객들을 인근 구조선으로 이송하려는 용도였으므로 타이타닉호 안에는 탑승한 승객의 약 절반만을 수송할 구명보트가 있었습니다. 선박사고 사상 최대치인 1500여명이 목숨을 잃었습니다. 이번 참사는 엄청난 인명피해를 불러왔고, 규제와 운영 실패에 전세계가 충격과 분노로 가득했습니다.
column3: At 11:40 p.m. an iceberg was spotted immediately ahead of the Titanic and the bridge was alerted. The First Officer ordered the ship to be steered around the obstacle and the engines to be put in reverse, but it was too late: the starboard side struck the iceberg, creating a series of holes below the waterline. Five of the ship's watertight compartments were breached. It soon became clear that the ship was doomed, as it could not survive more than four compartments being flooded. It began sinking bow-first, with water spilling from compartment to compartment as its angle in the water became steeper. Ships in $YEAR$ were seen as largely unsinkable and lifeboats were intended to transfer passengers to nearby rescue vessels so Titanic only had enough lifeboats to carry about half of those on board. More than 1500 people died, the biggest toll in history. The disaster was greeted with worldwide shock and outrage at the huge loss of life and the regulatory and operational failures that had led to it.
Our nation mourns those who died.

column2: 알리 파샤를 동방 위기 때 다시 복속하면서 이집트도 제국의 일부로 남았습니다. 하지만 최근 강대국들끼리의 회의는 아프리카에 초점을 맞췄습니다. 그리고 그들은 이미 이집트에서 우리의 권위를 손상하려 노력하는 동시에, 확실하게 스스로를 위해 합병을 모색하고 있습니다.
column3: Ali Pasha was brought back to the fold during the Oriental Crisis and Egypt remained a part of the Empire. However, the latest Conference of the Great Powers has them set their eyes in Africa, and they already worked their way to undermine our authority in Egypt, which they undoubtedly seek to annex for themselves.

column2: 자신의 땅을 습격하고 야심의 대상으로 삼는 아프가니스탄의 부족을 걱정하던 치트랄 군주가 우리에게 접근해 보호를 요청했습니다. 군주를 단지 명목상 우두머리로 만든 후에 우리의 보호를 허락할 수도 있고, 군주에게 약간의 자치를 허락하거나 그 제안을 완전히 거부하는 선택지도 있습니다.
column3: The Prince of Chitral, worried about afghan raiding tribes and ambitions in his land, plagued by strife in the royal family, approached us and asked us for protection. We can make the prince merely a figure head, grant him our protection but let him some self rule or reject the offer altogether.
We have no interest in helping him.

column2: 전쟁이 끝나면서 시암은 라오스를 $COUNTRY$에 양도하기로 합의했고, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ 인도차이나는 크게 팽창했습니다. $YEAR$년 $COUNTRY$은(는) 시암과 라오스와 그 영토 사이의 경계를 정의하는 조약에 서명했습니다. 라오스 왕국은 인도차이나 총독 밑의 보호령으로 전락했습니다.
column3: With the end of the war, the Siamese agreed to cede Laos to $COUNTRY$, significantly expanding $COUNTRY$ Indochina. In $YEAR$, $COUNTRY$ signed a treaty with the Siamese defining the border between Laos and their territory. The Kingdom of Laos became a protectorate, initially placed under the Governor General of Indochina.

column2: 방콕과의 관계가 라오스에 대한 지배권 분쟁으로 솟구쳤습니다. 우리 외교관이 루앙프라방에서 방콕으로 가던 도중에 살해당하자 중앙정부는 라타나코신 국왕과 직접 협상하기 위해 선박을 보냈습니다. 양국의 충돌은 우리나라가 두 대의 범선과 포함에게 시암의 허락 없이 차오프라야강에서 방콕으로 항해하라는 명령을 내리면서 일어났습니다. $YEAR$년 그들은 팍남 요새에서 포격을 받았습니다. $COUNTRY$도 화력으로 되갚아주면서 방콕으로 향했습니다. 방콕의 대궁전에서 총기를 훈련시킨 가운데, $COUNTRY$은(는) 시암에게 '영토를 양도하고, 주둔지에서 철수하고, 팍남 전투에 대한 배상금으로 2백만 파운드를 지불하고, 분쟁 지역에서의 살인에 책임이 있는 사람들을 처벌하라'는 최후통첩을 보냈습니다.
column3: Our relations with Bangkok soared over disputes of control over Laos. One of our diplomats was killed on his way from Luang Prabang to Bangkok and the central government sent ships to negotiate with the Rattanakosin king. Conflict arose when two $COUNTRY$ ships, a sloop and a gunboat, were ordered to sail up the Chao Phraya towards Bangkok, without the permission of the Siamese: they came under fire from the fort at Paknam on $YEAR$. The $COUNTRY$ returned fire and forced their way to Bangkok. With guns trained on the Grand Palace in Bangkok, the $COUNTRY$ delivered an ultimatum to the Siamese to hand over the territory, to withdraw their garrisons there, to pay an indemnity of two million in reparation for the fighting at Paknam, and to punish those responsible for the killings in the disputed territory.
Lift up the siege and let it go.
The Black Flag Army in Luang Prabang

column2: 흑기군은 1865년 중국 광서에서 당시 대남(베트남) 제국의 일부인 상부 통킹으로 국경을 넘은 장족 출신 도적단의 잔당입니다. 1887년 흑기군은 약탈을 위해 루앙프라방의 국경을 넘어갔습니다. 작은 왕국은 스스로를 방어할 수 없었고, 그 이후로 우리에게 보호를 청원했습니다.
column3: The Black Flag Army was a splinter remnant of a bandit group recruited largely from soldiers of ethnic Zhuang background, who crossed the border in 1865 from Guangxi, China into Upper Tonkin, then part of the Empire of Annam (Vietnam). In 1887, the Black Flag bandits crossed the border of Luang Prabang to ransack and pillage. The small Lao kingdom was unable to defend itself and since then, they petitioned us for protection.
We have no interest in helping them.

column2: 바레인의 지도부와 카타르 지도부 간에 전쟁이 발발했는데, 이는 바레인의 칼리파 가문과 맺은 여러 조약에 위배됩니다. 카타르의 고위인사들이 우리나라에 도움을 요청했고, 인근 지방의 총독들도 $COUNTRY$의 개입을 강력히 지지했습니다.
column3: A war has broken out between the rulers of Bahrain and Qatar, in violation with several treaties we had with the house Al Khalifa from Bahrain. Qatar dignitaries came to our country to ask for help and governors of regions nearby are strongly in favor of a $COUNTRY$ intervention.

column2: 우리의 봉신 카타르의 반역자 빈 타니 가문이 자신들의 영토에서 발생한 반란에 대해 독립을 선언했습니다. 도하와 그 반도는 적법한 우리 소유이고, 칼리파 가문은 이를 지지하지 않을 터입니다.
column3: The traitorous house of bin Thani in Qatar, our vassals, are declaring independence over rebellions that broke out in their territory. Doha and the peninsula rightfully belong to us and the house of Al Khalifa won't stand for this.
Unite the tribes and march for Doha!

column2: $YEAR$년, $COUNTRY$-시킴 정부의 대외관계를 담당하던 두 명의 의사가 정부에 알리지 않고 시킴의 산속으로 들어갔습니다. 시킴 정부는 의사들을 억류했고, 현재 고위 관료들은 시킴 정부를 토벌할 원정을 준비할 것을 요구하고 있습니다.
column3: In $YEAR$, two $COUNTRY$ physicians, one being in charge of relations between the $COUNTRY$ and Sikkimese governments, ventured into the mountains of Sikkim unannounced and unauthorized. The doctors were detained by the Sikkimese government, and now high ranking officials are demanding that we outfit a punitive expedition to punish the Sikkimese government.

column2: $PROVINCENAME$ 금광을 금이 고갈될 때까지 사용한 결과 지금은 노동자들의 흔적을 더이상 찾을 수 없습니다. 광산은 천천히 버려졌고 노동자들은 농부로서 정착했습니다.
column3: We worked our gold mines in $PROVINCENAME$ to exhaustion and now the workers can't find any more veils. Slowly, the mines were abandoned and the workers settled as farmers.

column2: 소위 파드리(메카 순례 이후 와하브파의 교리에 경도된 수마트라의 무슬림 성직자)라는 자들이 서수마트라의 미낭카바우의 귀족들과 지도자에게 샤리아(이슬람식 율법)를 강요하고 싶어했고, 이로 인해 1803년부터 $YEAR$년까지 인도네시아 서수마트라에서 파드리 전쟁(미낭카바우 전쟁이라고도 함)이 일어났습니다. 미낭카바우는 네덜란드에 도움을 요청했고, 네덜란드는 1821년부터 개입해 귀족들이 파드리파를 물리치도록 도왔습니다. 현재 마상 조약이 체결되고 있으며, 이 승리로 네덜란드 정부는 서수마트라에 대한 지배권을 강화했습니다.
column3: The Padri War (also called the Minangkabau War) was fought from 1803 until $YEAR$ in West Sumatra, Indonesia between the so-called Padris, Muslim clerics from Sumatra who, inspired by Wahhabism and after returning from Hajj, wanted to impose sharia in Minangkabau country in West Sumatra, Indonesia, and the Minangkabau nobility and traditional chiefs. The latter asked for the help of the Dutch, who intervened from 1821 and helped the nobility defeat the Padri faction. The Masang Treaty is now being signed and with the victory, the Dutch government tightened their hold on West Sumatra.

column2: 패배한 베드르 칸은 크레타로 추방당했고, 여생을 유배지에서 보냈습니다. 쿠르드 자치단체는 철회당했으며, 반군들은 자치권에 대한 희망을 잃었습니다. 쿠르드 지역에 대한 질서가 회복된 이후 오스만 제국과 카자르 왕조 페르시아 사이의 긴장이 고조되었습니다. 국경분쟁은 이제 흔한 일로, 양국간 주전주의적 정서를 고조시키고 있습니다. 이 지역에 대한 그들의 이익을 보호하고자 하던 영국과 러시아는 이 지역을 괴롭혀온 문제들에 대한 외교적 해결책을 모색한다는 명목으로 개입했습니다. 양국이 제안받은 조약에는 영토 타협에서부터 순례자의 지위에 이르기까지 다양한 문제를 다루는 9개의 조항이 포함되어 있으며, 이 지역의 국가와 국경에 관한 서구적 개념을 영원히 확립하려 합니다.
column3: Bedr Khan has been defeated and was deported to Crete, to live the rest of his life in exile. Kurdish autonomy has been revoked and the rebels have lost any hope of autonomy. The lands Bedr Khan took from the Persians were returned and the Assyrians breath with relief at the sight of the marching Ottoman troops.

column2: 부하라 토후국의 몰락과 함께 칸다하르에 대한 부하라의 오래된 영유권은 사라졌으며, 그 지역은 우리의 수중에 확고히 자리잡았습니다.
column3: With the fall of the Bukharan Emirate, their old claims in Kandahar are slipping away and the province is firmly in our hands.

column2: 영유권 주장을 해결했으니, 이제는 주변국과의 외교 관계를 재정립하고 갈등을 뒤로 미루어야 할 때입니다.
column3: With our outstanding claims resolved, it's time to reestablish diplomatic relations with our neighbors and let our conflicts behind.
Let there be peace in South America.
We will never give up our claims.

column2: 베드르 칸 주변의 이슬람 부족 지도자들은 "지구에서 기독교인들의 시대는 끝났으며 그들을 죽이는 것은 경건한 행위다."라고 계속해서 말했습니다. 따라서 그 지역에 거주하는 기독교인들은 이슬람교로 개종하거나 다른 지역으로 도망칠 수 밖에 없었습니다. 보탄 쿠르드족들의 광적인 분노가 자신들의 통치하에 있는 이교도들에게 떨어졌기 때문입니다.
column3: The Muslim tribal leaders around Bedr Khan kept saying "the time of the Christians on earth is over and killing them is thawab, a pious act". Thus, the Christians were forced to convert to Islam or flee to other districts, as the zealot fury of the Kurds of Bohtan fell on the kafirs, the unbelievers, under their rule.

column2: 야쿠브 라이스의 집에 도착하자마자, '베이(태수)가 왔다'는 외침이 마을 전체에 퍼졌습니다. 베드르 칸의 위협적인 침략에 마을은 정말 큰 경각심을 느꼈습니다. 예전의 대학살을 면한 트호마는 이제 광적인 복수심의 대상을 그로 정했습니다.\n베드르 칸은 보탄 토후국의 젊고 야심찬 통치자입니다. 술탄 마흐무드 2세의 현대화 및 중앙집권화 정책에 반감을 품은 그는 쿠르드족 봉건지도자들과 함께 터키의 지배에 대항하는 반란을 일으켰습니다. 당시 터키군은 이집트와의 전쟁에 집중해야 했으므로 반란을 진압할 수 없었습니다. 그 결과 그는 영역을 마하바드까지 확장했고, 쿠르드 부족들은 그에게 충성을 맹세했습니다. 그는 다위시의 광신적 교리를 채택했으며 쿠르드인들에게 아시리아인들과 야지디인들을 집단적으로 살해하도록 격려했습니다. 그 젊은 지도자는 전쟁행위로 여겨질 수 있음에도 국내의 쿠르드족 거주지를 침공할 정도로 대담합니다.
column3: We had no sooner reached the house of Yakoub Rais, then a cry of The bey has come" spread through the village. The village was in the greatest alarm at a threatened invasion from Bedr Khan. The district of Tkhoma, which had escaped the former massacre, was now the object of his fanatical vengeance." Bedr Khan is the young and ambitious ruler of the Emirate of Bohtan. During the war with Egypt, Turkish troops were preoccupied with invading Egyptian troops and were unable to suppress his revolt, a reaction to the modernizing and centralizing efforts of Sultan Mahmud II that were antagonized by the Kurdish feudal chiefs. As a result, he extended his authority up to Mahabad, with Kurdish tribes pledging fealty to him. He adopted the fanatical tenets of Darwishes and was encouraged to undertake mass slaughters against Assyrians and Yazidis in the territory he controlled. The young leader was so bold as to invade kurdish lands in our country, an unmistakable act of war.

column2: 야쿠브 라이스의 집에 도착하자마자, '베이(태수)가 왔다'는 외침이 마을 전체에 퍼졌습니다. 베드르 칸의 위협적인 침략에 마을은 정말 큰 경각심을 느꼈습니다. 예전의 대학살을 면한 트호마는 이제 광적인 복수심의 대상을 그로 정했습니다.\n베드르 칸은 보탄 토후국의 젊고 야심찬 통치자입니다. 술탄 마흐무드 2세의 현대화 및 중앙집권화 정책에 반감을 품은 그는 쿠르드족 봉건지도자들과 함께 터키의 지배에 대항하는 반란을 일으켰습니다. 당시 터키군은 이집트와의 전쟁에 집중해야 했으므로 반란을 진압할 수 없었습니다. 그 결과 그는 영역을 마하바드까지 확장했고, 쿠르드 부족들은 그에게 충성을 맹세했습니다. 그는 다위시의 광신적 교리를 채택했으며 쿠르드인들에게 아시리아인들과 야지디인들을 집단적으로 살해하도록 격려했습니다. 기독교도에 대한 형편없는 대우에 격분한 강대국들은 즉시 개입할 것을 요구해왔습니다.
column3: We had no sooner reached the house of Yakoub Rais, then a cry of The bey has come" spread through the village. The village was in the greatest alarm at a threatened invasion from Bedr Khan. The district of Tkhoma, which had escaped the former massacre, was now the object of his fanatical vengeance." Bedr Khan is the young and ambitious ruler of the Emirate of Bohtan.
