The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

Scandinavian dominance over North Germany is complete, with most of the Elbian people united under the heel of Copenhagen, giving them an increased power. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

The house of Valois has taken Rome and formed a united Italian kingdom following their Tuscan adventures. It seems though that they don't feel like be satisfied with this and fights with Aragon or Venice are to be expected. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

The old line of the Valois has retaken their old capital of Paris following their hundreds of years in exile, threatening the old balance of power. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

The Republicans of Italy have managed to unify the Peninsula under their ideas and are now preparing to fight against all reactionaries of Europe, if rumors are to be believed. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

It seems that the Dual-Monarchy of France and England has managed to stabilize and unify the population despite all odds. Their power which was already the first in Europe is now without equal. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

The English Revolution has managed to fight back against the Dual-Monarchy leading to their recognition by many other countries in Europe, and upsetting the balance of power. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.

The old Plantagenet Monarchy has been erased by revolutionaries, who have now completely changed the borders of Europe. The Great Powers have assembled in $CAPITAL$ on the behest of $COUNTRY$ to put aside their grudges temporalily and establish a new set of international laws to avoid one state to take too much power at the expense of the others. It is the beginning of a new era for international relations and hopefully for peace!
A new era of diplomacy begins.
Where is the Source of the Nile?
The Royal Geographic Society has announced that an award will be presented to the first explorer who determines the source of the Nile.
We want no part of this fool's parade.
Our national expedition to find the source of the Nile has returned without success, but they have great hope that another expedition will succeed.
The Second Expedition to find the Source of the Nile has disappeared without a trace, and are now presumed lost? Should we make a third attempt in this quest?
The Source of the Nile Discovered
Our intrepid explorers have mapped out the source of the Nile, and have brought glory and prestige to our great country!
A glorious day for science in our nation!
The Royal Geographic Society has announced that an award will be presented to the first expedition that reaches the North Pole.
Is there anything worth discovering in the frozen north?
Our national expedition to reach the North Pole has returned without success, but they have great hope that another expedition will succeed.
The Second Expedition to reach the North Pole has disappeared without a trace, and are now presumed lost? Should we make a third attempt in this quest?
Our intrepid explorers have been the first to raise a flag at the North Pole and have brought glory and prestige to our great country!
The Royal Geographic Society has announced that an award will be presented to the first expedition that reaches the South Pole.
We do not need to rediscover penguins.
Our national expedition to reach the South Pole has returned without success, but they have great hope that another expedition will succeed.
The Second Expedition to reach the South Pole has disappeared without a trace, and are now presumed lost? Should we make a third attempt in this quest?
Our intrepid explorers have been the first to raise a flag at the South Pole and have brought glory and prestige to our great country!

A Comet was sighted in the sky, some believe that this portends fell times ahead. Others believe that they are in fact pixie faries floating in the sky. There are also those who believe that this comet is most probably a gaint ball of ice floating through the sky and the long tail is created due to the energy of the sun. The arguements amoungst the three equally viable theories is stimulating the pursuit of knowledge in our country.
Thank God we live in such enlighted times
The Source of the Nile Discovered?

I saw, about four miles to the left, a sheet of water, which ultimately proved to be a creek and the southernmost part of what the Arabs call the Ukerewe Sea. Convinced that I finally found the source of the Nile, I went down a grassy and jungly depression into a deep, dirty, viscid nullah, which communicated with the southern end of the creek, which we named Jordan. As we followed the creek, that increased in breadth as it extended northwards, we saw many little islands in Ukerewe, well wooded, standing boldly out of the water. The journey continued through another tortuous day until we reached the village of Isamiro, where the view was clearer and better. In the distant horizon a calm sea line started to appear between north and west. Even in a well known country the view would have attracted attention for its placid beauty, he thought to himself. He felt he had solved the great old riddle.
Our $MONARCHTITLE$ would be satisfied with the name...
This great body of water will be known as...
We need a name worthy of it's beauty...

One of our explorers found a massive body of water in Africa, and he claims that it's the true source of the Nile! Upon preliminary reports, it seems that what was found is a huge lake that might as well be the source of the Nile. He insists we should call this discovery Lake Victoria.

As the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election begins, the people are all too keenly aware that the nation exists in a state of war. Debates in $CAPITAL$ rage over the state of the war, though the overwhelming feeling is that now more than ever citizens should be supporting the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. Still, there are some who believe that now is the perfect time for change.
We must maintain stability even in a time of war.

As the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election begins, there is a general sense that things are not going to proceed smoothly. A sense of change is in the air, and while not everyone wants that change it seems there are many who have leapt upon the election as a chance to make it happen. A recent riot in $CAPITAL$ was only barely kept under control, and debates elsewhere in $COUNTRY$ are threatening to erupt into further violence as neither side is willing to budge.

$COUNTRY$ has its share of problems-- and as the current election gets underway, there is a sense among many that the current government is to blame. Justified or not, that anger has instilled a sense that a regime change may be in the offing. Those who previously had never considered voting for any other party than the one in power are now considering doing just that.

As the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election gets underway, it becomes clear it will be a contentious one. The issues are clear and the battle lines between parties drawn, and there are those who believe that while violence may not be the result the toppling of the current $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regime could be.

With the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election underway, supporters of the current regime have rallied in $CAPITAL$. They claim that stability is required to deal with the problems facing $COUNTRY$, and are actively trying to shout down opposition. Whether this will mean a victory in the current election is unknown.

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election is underway, and so far has proceeded smoothly. Debates are being carried out in the usual manner, and there are no reports of violence in $CAPITAL$ or elsewhere. Supporters of the ruling regime have turned out in force, as have the hopefuls seeking to defeat the current government.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the conservative party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the socialist party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the liberal party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the communist party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the fascist party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the reactionary party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the anarcho-liberal party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the social liberal party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.

A prominent pacifist preacher in $STATENAME$ has been arguing against the government taking any steps to bolster our nation's military. He has decried any type of military action aside from self-defense. We could silence him permanently, but such a move would spread unrest in the state and infuriate the clergy.
He can't preach from the grave.
Perhaps violence is not the answer.
Discredit the preacher, and hopefully reduce the impact of his message.
Counter him with a Pro-War campaign.

A decorated and high-ranking officer in $STATENAME$ has started to complain in public regarding his perceived lack of proper arms and supplies allocated to the military. He mingles his complaints with reminiscences of national glory and personal valor on far away battlefields. His voice carries great weight in both the military and general public. If we let him continue the state will undoubtedly become more jingoistic.
Counter him with an Anti-War campaign.
Help him to help the military.
If there's one thing we need more of it is surely more guns

A group of young officers in the state of $STATENAME$ have started a barfight over a prostitute in a local tavern and proceeded to kill three lower class workers. A sham trial in a military court has found all the officers innocent and the lower classes are infuriated. If we put them up for re-trial in a civil court the lower classes will be appeased but the image of the military will be hurt.
There is no need for a second trial.
Let us try to weasel our way out of this.
Put the other low-class workers on trial instead.

The deplorable conditions of a barracks in $STATENAME$ has become the subject of a widely read local newspaper. Maggot infested and rotten food along with faulty arms and ammunition has led to numerous injuries and outbreaks of disease. The barracks is supplied by a highly connected group of aristocrats and capitalists who are pressuring the government to ignore the matter, doing so will greatly upset the local soldiers. If we launch an official investigation the public will surely demand greater spending and oversight for military supply.
We cannot allow this to continue.
Just move our cattle to another barracks.
Put the responsible fat-cats on trial.

A major mine in $STATENAME$ has been running at a deficit for some time now and the owners are on the verge of bankruptcy. The labourers at the mine are unable to find alternative work and fear for their livelihoods. We could step in and subsidize or nationalize the mine but doing so will create greater expectations among the lower classes for intervention in the future.
The government has no role to play here.

A highly respected university professor has written an increasingly influential theory supporting a laissez-faire economic policy. His theory has gained many supporters from the artisans of the state who feel threatened by government ties to factory owners. Through our contacts we have learned that this man is a secret homosexual. We could use this against him publically but doing so will anger the artisans and atheists of the state.
His private affairs are none of our business.
Throw him in jail for deviant behavior.

Many of the factory workers in $STATENAME$ live a tragic life. Miserable and dejected," these poor souls are unable to fulfill even the most basic life needs. Among their flimsy shanties and squalid alleys a champion has risen among them. He preaches a new system to the hopeless masses in which every willing man and woman has a job and is provided for. A system in which the rich do not prey upon the weak. Factory workers across the state are heeding his words and the capitalists are fearful of the consequences. We could arrange an ""accident"" during his shift but that will cause great unrest among the workers.
His next shift will be his last.
Just fire him for causing trouble.
Back him up to get support for our own economic plans.
There's Something Rotten in the Choir

A dark and terrible secret has been brooding among the clergy in $STATENAME$. Whispers in dark corners speak of a deranged priest molesting young children. This pedophile has gone unchecked for quite some time while the rest of the clergy maintained disbelief. Now he is being shuffled about, moved from one parish to another, in order to cover up the story and secure the church's reputation. Rumours of his existence are spreading throughout the populace and the church is begging us to let them handle the matter. They claim that a public hearing would cause their flock to lose faith.
If the church will not provide justice, the state gallows will.
We could use this to lobby for the separation of state and church.
Let us conduct an investigation before jumping to conclusions.
This is a great evil, but the faithful must not fall into unholy disbelief.

One of the larger places of worship for our predominant faith in $STATENAME$ has started construction on an expansion. The construction workers have discovered a previously unknown graveyard on the expansion's land that houses the dead of a religious minority. The minority's leaders have insisted that the government halt the expansion. Doing so will appease the minority, but the clergy and moralists will be upset that a chance to put our faith forcefully above all others was missed, especially since the ground has already been consecrated.
We should try to find a compromise.
An excellent chance to provoke some violence.

In order to emphasize the multi-religious makeup of $STATENAME$ and the law's relationship with the divine, a courthouse in $STATENAME$ has taken upon itself to install a series of reliefs along its walls detailing great lawbringers from various faiths. The placement of such large and overtly religious carvings has caused a fiery debate to break out between those advocating a seperatation of religion and state and those who applaud the addition of pluralistic religious ideals to the courthouse. With whom shall we side?
We do not want to get involved. Let the locals decide.
Smash the reliefs into little bits.
You shall not call religion to the bench.
Heretics and heathens have no place in the courthouse.

A teenage girl was found beaten and raped in a cultural minority's section of a city in $STATENAME$. Since the authorities have no leads, members of our primary culture have taken it upon themselves to seek retribution on the minority and anti-minority sentiments are becoming widespread. The local government has turned a blind eye to the whole matter and let the attacks of retribution be carried out. Many people in $STATENAME$ are now calling for severe restrictions to be placed upon the minorities in the nation. Bringing the retribution-seeking attackers to justice probably will not abate the anti-minority sentiments. However, we could falsify an investigation into the rape and claim it was in fact not committed by a minority.
Let the bigotry flow high and wide.
Falsify a rape investigation to calm the masses.
We will uncover the truth and act accordingly.
My Four Walls and Nobody Else's

Minorities in $STATENAME$ are starting to gather and protest over the right to own property. Dishonest landowners in the state have repeatedly abused the minorities by collecting rent and then evicting them on false charges. The minorities have little legal recourse as their rights are almost non-existant. Recently, a family of immigrants who were wrongfully evicted from their residence died from exposure during an extremely cold night. Newspapers have picked up the story and are inflaming public opinion against our residency laws. We could let the anti-residency sentiments grow," or we could pay off some newspapers to run an opposing story detailing the ""uncouth and devious"" nature of the minority's culture.
These shameful laws have to be abolished.
These people are humans and they deserve rights.
We all know they are savages who would rather live in caves.
Run the counter-story and keep them repressed.

Minorities in $STATENAME$ have gradually lifted themselves out of poverty and into the middle class. They have started their own sports organizations, newspapers, and religious centers. A particularly racist and sharply divided town in $STATENAME$ has voted in a series of laws that effectively bans a large minority's most important cultural festival. The laws probably would not have garnered enough votes if cultural minorities were allowed to vote. The debate about spreading full citizenship to minorities is raging among the state's newspapers and those in favor of full citizenship seem to be gaining the most sympathy. To stop this movement we could stage an arson attack on the racist town's city hall and make it look like the minority was behind it.
Framing an arson attack on minorities? Brilliant.
We should rather use legislation to keep them at bay.
Let the debate take its course.

Artisans in $STATENAME$ fear for their livelihoods. In every stall in every market there seems to be more and more goods stocked from abroad. The artisans have started a public campaign to sway the rest of the population towards protectionism. Their rallying cry is simple and blunt: 'our nation, our markets, and our goods'. We could launch a public relations campaign detailing the importance of free trade to our export industry but such a move will disgruntle our artisans.
We understand their concerns, but times are changing and we will have to adapt.
Our nation, our markets, and our goods indeed.

An association of capitalists in $STATENAME$ have begun a public relations campaign educating their workers on the value of free trade. They have quite successfully persuaded the clerks and craftsmen of the state that free trade is in their and the factories' best interest. The free trade campaign has begun to make an impact on the population as a whole. We could launch a counter campaign emphasizing the necessity of protectionism to many facets of our economy but that would greatly upset the capitalists.
Our people are probably not ready for this.
Free trade is the path to prosperity.
A major abolutionist running for office in $STATENAME$ has challenged his slave-holding rival to a debate, which has drawn a great deal of attention in the current $COUNTRY_ADJ$ elections.

A debate being held in $STATENAME$ prompted a riot when arguments being made about slavery prompted anger by abolitionists in the crowd. So far no arrests have been made, but people on both sides of the debate have been calling for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to step in and punish those responsible.
We need less controls over industry, not more.
They are correct. Child labor should be reformed.
They should be grateful for what they have.
We should embrace our minority cultures.
There will be no reforms to immigration laws.
Reforming immigration should be a priority, no matter the opposition.
We've no reason to get involved.
Let the debate take its course.
We will not reform the slavery laws.

Following the elections in our Upper House, where the communists gained majority, they are now definitively able to took power in our nation, the country is declared a proletarian dictatorship ? a preliminary step toward communism. Bureaucratic centralism under the direction of Communist leadership is introduced. Dissident elements are purged from all levels of society, including the Church. The ideological principles of Marxism-Leninism and socialist realism pervade cultural and intellectual life. The entire education system is submitted to state control. With the elimination of private ownership, planned economy is introduced.

Following the elections in our Upper House, where the fascists gained majority, they are now definitively able to took power in our nation, the country is declared a fascist dictatorship ? a preliminary step toward national socialism. Bureaucratic centralism under the direction of Fascist leadership is introduced. Dissident elements are purged from all levels of society, including the Church. The ideological principles of national syndicalism and corporatism pervade cultural and intellectual life. The entire education system is submitted to state control. With the elimination of private ownership,state-controlled economy is introduced.

Following the elections in our Upper House, where the anarcho-liberals gained majority, they are now definitively able to took power in our nation, the country is declared a bourgeios dictatorship? a preliminary step toward libertarian anarchism. Bureaucratic centralism under the direction of Anarcho-liberal leadership is introduced. Dissident elements are purged from all levels of society, including the Church. The ideological principles of free-market capitalism and libertarianism pervade cultural and intellectual life. The entire education system is submitted to state control. With the restriction of private ownership, state-controlled capitalism is introduced.

Following the elections in our Upper House, where the reactionaries gained majority, they are now definitively able to took power in our nation, the country is declared a presidental dictatorship ? a preliminary step toward the status quo ante belum. Bureaucratic centralism under the direction of Reactionary leadership is introduced. Dissident elements are purged from all levels of society, including the Church. The ideological principles of legitimism and counterrevolutionarism pervade cultural and intellectual life. The entire education system is submitted to state control. With the elimination of private ownership, state-controlled economy is introduced.
Our glorious capital is now in very weak position and we should think about other options.

Dark day! Our Iberian territories are continuously shrinking, and soon even Barcelona will no longer be safe. Maybe we should start over in Italy, and hope to see our state prosper there more than in Iberia?
Italy is lost. Perhaps it is time to change our name accordingly.
There will be hell to pay!
We must salvage our relationship with $FROMCOUNTRY$
There will be hell to pay!
We must salvage our relationship with $FROMCOUNTRY$

In $YEAR$ the ambassadors of the King of the Dual Thrones of England and France and of the Most Catholic King and Emperor of Bohemia and the Holy Roman Empire met in Salzburg. They decided to discuss a possible pact between these two European Empires. As a symbol of this meeting, the Salzburgers built a bridge over Salzach, representing their friendship.
The fate of the Republic of Venice was decided long time ago in Salzburg. We have no option to refuse…

La Serenissima was defeated by the Imperial Forces. According to the Treaty of Salzach Austria tried to gain full control over the Republican territories. Because of the power vacuum in Italy there was noone to stop them.
Our republic has one last chance to survive - our eyes turn to England-France. Will Paris help?
The chaos now rules over Northern Italy and we could gain something from it.
There is more for us to gain
Our power in Italy is uncontested
My lord! The ruler of France demands us to give up and forfeit our lands to him. What is your decision?
We have no option to refuse
With the support of Paris we are able to usurp the Iron Throne.
The Duchy of Savoy demands our annexation.

The removal from the monarchy has provoked instability in the former Crown lands. Many English representatives want the different parts of the 'Angevin Empire' to live their own fate although less radical speakers only want autonomy. Will the Anglois Dream endure in the whole United Republic.
The United Republic has gained acceptance of all the peoples leaving in the former Crown lands, an achievement the Plantagenets could not get with their methods !
We don't need no monarch to be united ! Long Live the United Republic !
The United Republic is forced to grant autonomy to the English and Irish people. It still retains the greater part of Britain where the Anglois and Welsh are dominant.
England and Ireland deserve a special treatment after what they have suffered
The representatives from the British islands have completely refused to continue to live in the same state. The United Republic only rules continental lands and represent only 'France'.
It was good while it lasted ...
The existence of an English state has led to the dismantlement of the United Republic. Long live the French Republic !
The end of the Dual-Monarchy has led to the call of a council to know the future that awaits the heirs of the Angevin legacy ....
Despite the threat of nationalism the people of the former Dual-Monarchy stand united !
We don't need no monarch to be united ! Long Live the United Republic !

With the politics slightly focused on Britain, the capital has been move to London. The Anglois lands will still be under our control but the French and Occitan lands will be put under the supervizion of sister republics.
France and Occitania deserve a special treatment after what they have suffered

The Congress has ended and with it the legacy of the old monarchy. The old government has relocated to London, retaining the British islands, while the continental lands were divided between the new French and Occitan Republics...
It was good while it lasted ...
The continental lands have been abandoned to the French and Occitan republics. Long live the English Republic !
The United Republic has been proclaimed in the troubles following the Anglois policy. Now the representatives of all the former Crown lands have assembled. Will the Republic endure?
The peoples of the United Republic have decided to continue to share the same state and agenda! Democracy succeeds where the Monarchy failed!
We don't need no monarch to be united ! Long Live the United Republic !
The United Republic and the Anglois dream are dead. Where one state existed, 4 nations have arised, 4 nations that could change the face of Europe...
We did not revolt to stay together !
Nationalism has dissolved our state... Long live the French republic!
The government has fled to Londres following the loss of some French lands. The United Republic is now dead, long live the English Republic!

Two camps oppose in the question of education. First, the "Federalists" want to allow our accepted minorities to continue to use their language in school along with the standardized language of Paris. The "Unionists" want to affirm one language to strenghten the state around one people, speaking one language. Our decision will not only affect education and the removal of the local dialects in school will mean their slow disappearance of the Anglois society.
Our country is strong because of its variety !
A dried up old traveller has returned from the wilderness. When given a whiskey he says with a hoarse voice 'Gold! I have found Gold! A mountain of Gold!'

For a long time, rumors have circulated among natives of a mythical place on the highveld where gold nuggets the size of apples lie scattered openly on the ground. Whether the legend was originally a figment of fact or fiction, it was confirmed today, when prospectors in the Witwatersrand struck a motherlode of gold. News of the gold rush are spreading throughout the world like wildfire, and a new town has been incorporated in the province to deal with this new influx of fortune seekers and Uitlanders. The province will henceforth be known, simply, as 'Johannesburg'.

Lt. Colonel Custer reports back from the Black Hills with an announcement that gold in substantial quantities has been discovered in the Dakota territory. Prospectors, miners and fortune-seekers flock to the area, but troubling reports tell of strange howls and cries coming from the hills at night. Some say that the Sioux are going on the warpath...
A dried up old traveller has returned from the wilderness. When given a whiskey he says with a hoarse voice 'Diamonds! I have found Diamonds! A mountain of Diamonds!'

A small expedition that was sent to investigate $PROVINCENAME$ and its surroundings has made some quite interesting discoveries. According to the explorers, rubber trees are growing in abundance in the area. Their discovery could prove quite useful within the near future.
A dried up old traveller has returned from the wilderness. When given a whiskey he says with a hoarse voice 'Oil! I have found Oil! An ocean of Oil!'
We are under the influence of a Great Power, and as such we must permit them to station troops in our territory.
Let us hope they don't cause trouble
Our growing influence in a foreign government allows us to station troops in their territory.
With our country no longer dominated by our former protector, we needn't tolerate their troops in our territory.
Our waning influence in a foreign government means that we may no longer station troops within their borders.

Our nation is one of the most prestigeous Great Powers on Earth. From $CAPITAL$ to far flung provinces beyond, our flag flutters proudly in the winds, striking fear into the hearts of anyone who dare oppose us. In celebration of our dominance and just reign, an imperial parade is being planned in $CAPITAL$. The question that now poses itself is: Should we invite foreign dignitaries to this joyous occasion, or shall we simply conclude that no other nation is fit to bask with us in our place in the sun?
Relations with one of our allies have cooled. Perhaps we should reconsider our alliance?
We are under the influence of a Great Power. Or we should be.
We have begun to question our alliance to a great power that is clearly not our true protector.

The flora of $PROVINCENAME$ is spectacular, unique and mostly unknown to science. Here, in the vast spaces of unchartered land, an untold afflucene of botanical riches awaits the discoverer who dares brave the harsh and unforgiving climate in search of it. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Botanical Society is considering sending an expedition to $PROVINCENAME$, but, as is so often the case, funds are lacking. Sending an expedition could further the cause of science, but, beware, we might get competition...
We have better things to do

Rumors abound in botanical circles that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has launched a botanical expedition to $FROMPROVINCE$. According to the rumors, the flora of $FROMPROVINCE$ is a veritable courncopia of beauty and biological diversity. While $FROMPROVINCE$ is a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ colony, we could attempt to send an expedition of our own. It might be frowned upon, but the discoveries we could make do have a strange allure of their own.

The botanical expedition we dispatched some time ago has found itself stranded in Marrakech with a leaking hull and no rations. The expedition leader has sent word home, with a returning ship, requesting additional funds for the continued journey into the heart of darkness. Shall we provide the additional funds?
The cause of science demands it

... and, yet, while some amongst our citizenry can't afford the bare minimums of food and clothing, our government spends wasteful millions on sending expeditions to God-forsaken corners of nowhere in search of colorful flowers!'\n\nA debate has broken out in the Upper House over the botanical expedition that we decided to fund some time ago. Liberals oppose the expenses that the expedition has accrued, claiming that $COUNTRYNAME$ can ill afford such luxuries.

... thus, our expedition has now catalogued an additional 20 species of plantlife hereto uknown to science. During the past months two additional men have been claimed by the foul odors of malaria and dysentry, but, despite absent friends, morale among the men continues to be high. With best wishes, and love. Signed, ... '\n\nThe botanical expedition we dispatched has reported back. It is clear that, while they are making progress, they could use some additional support.
Let's see if they can find any edible plants

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Botanical Expedition that we dispatched some time ago hasn't been heard from in quite a while. Yesterday, we recieved a troubling report:

'The camp is deserted. Scattered around the former camp grounds are trace remnants of what I believe to be signs of a struggle. Tracks lead farther away into the vast inhospitable hell beyond. I believe this to be the end of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Botanical Expedition of $YEAR$'

It seems our exepedition has vanished.

The enormous white crown leaves of the flower shines with unrivaled luster. The botanical expedition we dispatched some time ago has returned home with a newly discovered flower. The flower, which is the size of the fist of a full grown man, has quickly become the talk of Europe, as gardeners all across the continent strive to cultivate it. In honor of the rich sponsorships we have provided our expedition the flower has been named 'The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Empress'. Our scientific discovery is the envy of the world.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ announced today that it has located the famed white flower that will henceforth be known as 'The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Empress'. In light of this discovery, our own botanical expedition has very limited outsights of finding anything that will rival the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ discovery. Our expedition has returned home, with limited success.

The streets of $CAPITAL$ were decorated in spring flowers today in celebration of the returning botanical expedition of $YEAR$. The expedition has been an astounding success, having catalogued more than one hundred new species of colonial flora. Our nation can take pride in itself, and know that its efforts have helped further the cause of science!
We will leave the matter alone for now.
Tell them we shall consider it.
We cannot afford such a conflict.

$COUNTRY$ is in a state of total war with one of the Great Powers of the world. In a modern age where warfare has the capability of killing millions, the very future of our nation could be at stake. The call has gone out to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people: put aside your petty differences," your day-to-day lives and your personal ambitions. $COUNTRY$ must pull together in this, our hour of need!
This should call any allies into the Great War.
Let's make sure we have everyone.
This removes the flag once peace is achieved.
Gives the AI the chance to call new allies into the war.

The constant state of war $COUNTRY$ is under has taken its toll on our people. Shortages of basic goods and the failure to deliver swift victory have worn down the enthusiasm with which the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people initially greeted the war effort. If things don't turn around soon, we could face growing weariness and unrest within our own borders.

Growing demonstrations in $CAPITAL$ demonstrate the prevailing attitude of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people: get us out of the war, and soon. Too many have been lost, too many sacrifices made, and all for what? The people wish to go back to their regular lives, without the constant spectre of war hanging over their heads.

The war effort is not going well, to put it lightly. Advisors are saying that $COUNTRY$ should sue for peace, do whatever it takes to end this war before something even more terrible happens. The people are on the brink of revolt. We must act!

We have lost the war, and like vultures the victors have descended upon us. We have been forced to the bargaining table to accept humiliating terms regarding the breakup of our empire, with many of our lands simply given away, and we shall be permitted no overseas holdings whatsoever. This is a moment that shall be remembered in $COUNTRY$ for years to come.

One of the matters discussed at the treaty talks is what to do with $FROMCOUNTRY$'s colonial holdings. They should not be allowed to keep these lands, but determinining how they should be disposed of is no simple matter. For now, agreement has been reached determining some of the territory, and any remaining will have to be negotiated over in the coming year.
We will take what we can
Our only interest is limiting $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ power
We have no interest in their colonies

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been forced to concede defeat in its war, and we have been invited to the negotiating table to discuss the potential breakup of their empire. This could potentially mean we see $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands returned to us, though if we forego our claims it could mean salvaging a relationship with $FROMCOUNTRY$.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been forced to concede defeat in its war, and now treaty talks have begun to discuss the breakup of their empire. As an enemy of $FROMCOUNTRY$, our place at the table is assured. At the very least, any $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands currently in $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ possession should be returned.
We simply wish our lands back

The defeat of $FROMCOUNTRY$ in their war has forced them to the negotiating table, and one of the terms for the breakup of their empire is our release from their direct rule. This would mean casting out $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officials and potentially turning them into an enemy. We could maintain our close ties with $FROMCOUNTRY$ even with our freedom, though this would mean passing up a chance for freedom and goodwill from $FROMCOUNTRY$'s enemies.

One of the matters discussed at the treaty talks is what to do with $FROMCOUNTRY$'s colonial holdings. We are not a great power, and it's possible that even if pursue some of their colonies for our own we'll end up with nothing... but if we do not try, we'll end up with nothing for sure. Even so, making the attempt could be seen as aggressive.
We are in the process of negotiating the disbursement of our colonies and overseas territories.
With the war finished, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have taken to the streets of $CAPITAL$ in celebration. The toll of the war has been heavy, but today $COUNTRY$ is simply happy to be at peace.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been created from the ether, but the powers-that-be have determined at least some of their lands rightfully belong to $COUNTRY$ and should be returned to us. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have rejoiced at this news.

Now that we are in a state of total war, the idea has arisen that $COUNTRY$ should approach $FROMCOUNTRY$'s enemies to see if there are those who would join our side against them. This may mean an unholy alliance with those who might never fight at our side otherwise, but as the old saying goes: 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend.' If we are to win the war against $FROMCOUNTRY$, we may have to take that to heart.

A diplomat from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a proposal: an alliance with them, to fight in a war against their enemy... who is certainly no friend of ours. While the alliance does not necessarily obligate us, the question really remains whether or not $COUNTRY$ even wishes to go to war. If we fight with $FROMCOUNTRY$, we stand the chance of gaining the spoils of war for ourselves. It also means we could fall with them. The choice is ours.
We have received word from $FROMCOUNTRY$ that they have agreed to an alliance. Whether or not they will actually live up to that alliance and join us in the war remains to be seen.

A diplomatic incident with one of our enemies has outraged $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens. Several weeks ago, an envoy assigned to $CAPITAL$ was accused of stealing national secrets. It turned out the truth was far worse, and an investigation has unearthed a conspiracy to destablize $COUNTRY$ and leave it week for invasion. This has leaked out to the public, and now crowds in the capital are calling for total war.
We must defend $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests, no matter the cost.
We cannot afford such a war.

The assassination of a prominent $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen by a dissident has, after a thorough investigation, turned out to be at the instigation of an enemy power. This is but the latest in a string of incidents designed to destabilize $COUNTRY$. The results of the investigation have leaked to the public, and massive crowds gathered in the streets of $CAPITAL$ are now calling for total war.

According to the peace treaty, our colonies and overseas territories must be surrendered. Negotiations are currently underway as to which nations they will be 'assigned' to. It appears our humiliation is not yet complete.
Time to carve up our empire.
Negotiations are still underway as to which countries will obtain control over the remaining $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies and overseas territories.
We will accept control over the colony.
We do not wish any more colonies.

An isolated $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory has been offered to us. We should consider whether we wish to adminster it, as accessing the land may be difficult according to current borders. But, then again, do we truly wish $FROMCOUNTRY$ to keep it?

As the armies of our former enemy depart $CAPITAL$, they leave behind a newly-installed democratic government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown, but many within $COUNTRY$ question whether 'freedom' imposed by a foreign power is truly that.

As the armies of our former enemy leave $CAPITAL$, they leave behind a newly-installed fascist government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown, but many within $COUNTRY$ seem already determined to overthrow it in the name of freedom.

As the armies of our former enemy leave $CAPITAL$, they leave behind a newly-installed communist government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown, but many within $COUNTRY$ seem already determined to overthrow it in the name of freedom.

With the loss of $COUNTRY$ in the recent war, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy has received much of the blame-- there have already been several assassination attempts, and calls within the government for the monarchy to step down. Sentiment in the public has turned to the notion of $COUNTRY$ becoming a democracy... though some fear this will plunge the nation into even further chaos.
The monarchy will go into exile.
The Bohemians have defeated us and demand the Imperial territory under our control.
There is nothing we can do.
I don't know what is going to happen
The Emperor has decided to pursue the centralisation of the empire.
The Emperor has decided to pursue the centralisation of the empire.
The Emperor has decided to pursue the centralisation of the empire.

After having reaffirmed his hegemony over the various principalities of the Holy Roman Empire, the emperor, Sigismund V has issued a Proclamation destined to all the members of the Imperial Diet. Determined to pursue the reforms of centralization advocated by his father Wenceslaus VIII during the German Wars, the emperor asks all the princes of the empires to join in a single state from the Danube to the Elbe. Should the Empire be centralized it would mean an upheaval of the balance of powers on the continent but nothing is set in stone for now.
The Proclamation has had various results throughout the Empire. Already all the good princes have joined the Reich !

The majority of the princes and free cities of the Empire have accepted the Proclamation. The discordant voices are alone amongst this common sentiment. The Emperor is really now the king of the Germans and to give them guarantees he already moved his court to Frankfurt am Main where all the institutions will be centralized. However this move has angered the Bohemians who don’t accept to be the heart of the Empire and the idea of secession is brewing in the mind of some.
Long live the unified Holy Roman Empire !
Instead of achieving a centralized empire the Proclamation launched the contrary move. All German princes ahve united and are marching toward Prague !
Well we'll just do it without their consent !
We unite to push back the Bohemians !
Time to push back the Bohemians ! We will show the worth of the true Germans !
We won't go down without a fight !
The bastards. Time to push them back !
Time to push back the Bohemians ! We will show the worth of the true Germans !
The bastards. Time to push them back !
Time to push back the Bohemians ! We will show the worth of the true Germans !
The bastards. Time to push them back !
We have been defeated by the Germans. Already our power barely extands outside of the Bohemian Crown. The HRE is now forfeit and we go back to being Bohemians....
The princes of the Empire did not go much in favour or against the centralisation and most are pushing for negotiations. We'll see that in each region
It could be better but ... it could be much worse
Rhenish princes have majority integrated the Empire. Our power is now felt along the Rhine and already our brothers from Aachen and Trier await us ....
The Rhenish princes have opposed the centralisation and already are revolting against our fair rule !
As for the Empire as a whole no tendency has won in Rhineland. The various princes of the area have begun the negotiations with the Emperor himself for keeping their privileges
Time to push back the Bohemians ! We will show the worth of the true Germans !
We have to watch these negotiations in the West ...
Elbian princes have for the majority integrated the Empire. Our power is now felt along the Elbe and already our brothers from Kiel and Heligoland await us ....
The Elbian princes have opposed the centralisation and already are revolting against our fair rule !
Like the Empire as a whole no tendency has won in North Germany. The various princes of the area have begun the negotiations with the Emperor himself for keeping their privileges
Time to push back the Bohemians ! We will show the worth of the true Germans !
Danubian princes have for the majority integrated the Empire. Our power is now felt along the Danube and the biggest threat to the Imperial integrity is now in our control
The Danubian princes have opposed the centralisation and already are revolting against our fair rule !
Like the Empire as a whole no tendency has won in North Germany. The various princes of the area have begun the negotiations with the Emperor himself for keeping their privileges
Time to push back the Bohemians ! We will show the worth of the true Germans !
We are happy to integrate the Holy Roman Empire
The local diets have shown different results and we've entered negotiations with the various princes. How it will end is another matter though
We'll await the end of negotiations then

Ulcerated by the slowness of the negotiations, the Emperor Sigismund has decided to use the harsh way to pass his ideas : Submission or Conquest, here is the choice he left to the last independent princes
Submission or Conquest, that's their only choice now
The Danubians have refused the ultimatum !
It can't be avoided then. Onwards !
The Elbians have refused the ultimatum !
It can't be avoided then. Onwards !
The Rhenish have refused the ultimatum !
It can't be avoided then. Onwards !
We have to watch these negotiations in the North ...

Lion over Eagle! "We are no Germans!" "Down with the traitor!" These and many more shouts can be heard almost everyday in Prague, Pilsen, Brunn,...The Bohemian people feel betrayed by the recent development in the realm and they fear that their privileged position they have been enjoying as citizens of the Imperial heartland for centuries is waning. Is it a sign of things to come ?
I fear we have awaken something ...

It started as a meaningless brawl. One drunk Bohemian anti-Imperialist was loudly swearing and a nearby walking police officer tried to calm him down, only to be punched to the face. When the officer tried to defend himself, the drunk pulled a knife, the policeman panicked and shot him in the chest. Other Bohemians seeing that promptly killed the officer, stormed a close weapons depot and started building a barricade in one of the city's streets. Looks like trouble is brewing.
They can complain, it's not like they'll get any results

To arms! To arms! For our freedom and our pride! Down with the German tyranny! After a series of incidents following the unification of the Holy Roman Empire and the subsequent centralisation acts, the situation in Bohemia escalated in a full-blown crisis. Bohemian aristocrats formed a national assembly and declared the Bohemian Crown Lands independent from the rest of the Empire. Disgruntled Bohemians, joined by many veteran soldiers of Holy Roman armies are already flocking to their ranks, gearing for war. Is peace in central Europe really a dream impossible to come true?
When one attacks the Empire, the Empire strikes back !
With the Bohemians rebelling, we have a chance to cripple the Kaiserreich. For glory !
At last we have succeeded. The war cost us many lives but we have secured our homeland from the traitor Kaiser ! Let it be known that Bohemia will never bow again before the Germans !

Now it is obvious that the war between the Holy Roman Empire and Bohemia will be fought on a scale never seen before. The Bohemian citizens are en masse joining the Free Corps and donating their belongings to the war effort. The story of a girl who, having no other property or money, donated a lock of her hair is just one of the many. The Bohemian lion is now standing tall, ready to take on his enemies.
We shall be free from the Emperor's yoke !

Ein Reich, ein Deutschland. That's easier to say than to fulfil. The Bohemians decided not to be just regular members of the Holy Roman Empire and somehow managed to defeat our newborn country, striking a deep wound into its flesh. With the blue-red-white tricolour flying over the Prague Castle, they have lost the chance to be full citizens of the Empire.

Ein Reich, ein Deutschland. Only fools would want to stand against the wind of destiny. The foolish Bohemians have tried to do just that and paid the price of blood for it. But our Empire has bled, too, and so it is important that the peace shall now rule in Mitteleuropa for eternity. And thanks only to our glorious nation.
The war is over and won. The national assembly is now to be dissolved and replaced with a proper form of government. The only question now stands - what form it shall take?
The composer Smetana has published his new opus, 'Bohemian Rhapsody'. This little romantic music has been a great success at the court in Prague and musicians from the whole world are now playing it!
I heard that you could hear that even in Zanzibar!

In the Year of the Lord 800, Karl the Great, King of the Franks, was crowned Roman Emperor by the Pope in Rome invocating the Translatio Imperii, and thus claiming the inheritance of the old Empire. The Empire would disappear for a few decades because of wars between the Karling kings but would be revived by Otto I in 967. Today marks the celebration of the crowning of Charlemagne and show the resiliency of the Empire, which has however deeply evolved over the centuries to become an Empire of the German Nation. The Emperor will attend mass in the Palatine Chapel, the personal Church of Karl der Grosse in memory of the Father of Europe.
May it live for a thousand year more!

The Holy Crown of Saint Stefen is the most important relics of Hungary. No Hungarian King could really be considered worthy of ruling until he had been crowned with this very Crown. The Kings of Bohemia have been in control of the Crown since the Ottoman Conquest, transferring the Crown in Prague where it would not be threatened. But the Dukes of Nitra we established to protect our lands proclaimed themselves Kings of Hungary following the expelling of the Turks. Gabriel I of Hungary has come to ask us to relinquish the Crown once and for all and is ready to “give in to any demands”.
Give the Crown to him, we want a good neighbour in Hungary
Ask him to bow in Prague, before Us
Ask him to relinquish Nitra as a March between our Kingdoms

The Emperor has granted our request without any demands ! The Crown has been escorted to Budapest where Gabor I was formally crowned King of Hungary. It will surely inaugurate a new period of peace between our Kingdoms!
The Emperor will only relinquish the Crown if we go to Prague and kneel before him. This move would damage our international status but we need it to secure our Throne
Accept for the good of Hungary...
Try to recover it by 'other means'...
We don't need it after all!

After negotiations the King of Hungary has come to Prague to regain the Holy Crown of Saint Stefen. The most precious relic of the Kingdom was only given to Gabor I after he knelt before the Bohemian Emperor in an humiliating ceremonial. The move has critically damaged the international standing of the Hungarian Kingdom along with their relations with Bohemia. One can guess that Bohemia made a serious enemy of her neighbour…
The King of Hungary has refused our offer.

The Bohemian Emperor has asked us to release a semi-independent Duchy of Nitra in exchange of the Crown of San Stefen. Nitra was the march installed by the Jagiellon to protect the Empire from Turkish attacks but it was ruled by Hungarian noblemen following the marriage between Charles Bethven and Maria Jagiellon, duchess of Nitra. The Hungarian revolution saw the duke of Nitra become King of Hungary by popular demands but it felt like an insult for Prague. Giving up full control on the duchy will surely be a thorn for our Kingdom but we would gain the Holy Crown…
We don't need it after all!
At our demand the King of Hungary has offered autonomy to the Slovaks and we have been allowed a right to intervene in their affairs
The Bohemians have refused to give us the Crown and they will refuse all concessions we might offer...
Try to recover it at all costs!

Stupor has struck Prague after an attempt by Hungarian nationalists to gain the Holy Crown! A dozen of Hungarian plotters bribed their way in the Castle of Prague and killed at least 27 guards before being caught. The question made them reveal that they were helped by the Hungarian government after the failure of negotiations to gain the Holy Crown. Such a slanderous behaviour needs to be addressed firmly without waiting for ‘apologies’. We’ll make Hungary pay for this!

Our government had secretly funded Magyar nationalists to steal the Holy Crown in Prague and bring it to Budapest but the Heist did not go as planned. Now Bohemian Forces are mobilizing and we must now march to Prague and take back the Crown!
And they said it could not backfire....
Gabor I Bethmen was solemnly crowned yesterday in Budapest by the archbishop with the Holy Crown of St Stefen! Despite the difficulty we are now possessing once again our most precious jewel.
The Hungarian armies have stormed our capital, taking back their crown and forcing to apologize for our misdeeds....
The Bohemian armies have stormed our capital,forcing us to apologize for our misdeeds and relinquish Slovakia...
The Magyars have been dealt with ! Another superb victory for the Emperor !
The Catalan leaders have gathered in Barcelona and now they are discussing whether they shall accept our rule or not.
We shall wait for the result

The region of Rif controls the African part of the Gibraltar strait, which controls a large portion of the international trade. Rif was integrated into our Mauretanian colony but some inhabitants have demanded to be integrated directly into Spain. It is the region where the Spanish are the more numerous and it could be interesting to keep it even if we grant autonomy to the Berbers in the future.
We need both banks of the strait
With the Commonwealth proclaimed, the local government has accessed to home-rule.
Viva la Mancomunidad de las Naciones Columbianas!
The Cubans have asked to be granted the same status as their Colombian brothers.
This can only be good for the empire.
No, they shall remain under our direct control
An intiguing challenge to the Classic Liberalism has emerged.
We will observe this with great interest.

Italian politics have seen the rise of a new political movement : the Socialists. Inspired by the ideas of the Revolution this young movement has pledged to protect the people from its oppressors and press for more rights for the workers. Already similar movements have arisen throughout Europe and others civilized nations and their support of the masses could see a shif in politics. Inspired by their endeavour a young German called Marx has published the Communist Manifesto, which is already seen by some circles as the ideological pillar of the years to come.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristrocrats has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of reactionary thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once a bastion of reactionary support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the reactionaries is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristrocrats has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning it into a stronghold of reactionary thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

A group of $COUNTRY$'s wealthy elite has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of conservative thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once a bastion of conservative support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the conservatives is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ agitators has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of liberal thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once a bastion of liberal support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the liberals is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ agitators has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning it into a stronghold of liberal thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

A group of $COUNTRY$'s intellectual elite has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of anarcho-liberal thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once considered a bastion of anarcho-liberal support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the anarcho-liberals is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

A group of $COUNTRY$'s intellectual elite has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning it into a stronghold of anarcho-liberal thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ workers has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of socialist thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once considered a bastion of socialist support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the socialists is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ workers has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning it into a stronghold of socialist thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ marxists has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of communist thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once considered a bastion of communist support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the communists is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ marxists has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning it into a stronghold of communist thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nationalists has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning all of $STATENAME$ into a stronghold of fascist thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $STATENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

$PROVINCENAME$, once considered a bastion of fascist support, has seen a shift in its ideology. Indeed, all throughout $STATENAME$ it seems that support for the fascists is crumbling. While some consider this a good thing, others in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are concerned at what will next rise to take their place.

A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nationalists has gathered support in $PROVINCENAME$, quickly turning it into a stronghold of fascist thinking-- one that may endure for some time to come. It is almost certain that, should $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policies turn to something not of their liking, $PROVINCENAME$ will be one of the first regions where we see trouble begin.
They had best not cause trouble.

In $YEAR$ the young Incan emperor Usco Inca became old enough to take power from his regent. His first action taken upon gaining power was to rename himself Pachacuti II after the legendary founder of the Empire. His next move was to adopt as many western technologies and political ideas as possible. He reformed the absolute Incan monarchy into a constitutional monarchy and began widespread building projects accross the empire. We have been blessed to have a king as great as Pachacuti and may he bring our great nation back to it's former Glory! All hail Pachacuti II!

One of the most lasting legacies of Pachacuti II was his massive overhaul of the Incan educational system. Before his reign education was handled almost exclusively by the parents. Literacy was almost non-existant. All knowledge was passed down through the quipu,which were a form of knotted strings. Though they took on many aspects of a writting system,by being able to indicate placenames for example,they were far more unwieldy than a book. Pachacuti worked with the Quipucamayocs,or those who knew how to read the quipu,"to transcribe all of the knowledge contained in the quipu into the new Quechua alphabet he had adopted. This knowledge was then used as the basis for the new madatory school system he adopted, along with western science and technological education.

Upon the start the Incan Emperor Pachacuti II's reign the Quechua people of Cuzco and Arequipa began agitating to rejoin the Inca Empire. After repeatedly being ignored they have entered into open revolt. As the Incans grow in power and prestige it will become increasingly difficult to hold onto the area as it contains their ancestral capital. It maybe adventagous to transfer the lands peacefully to the Inca, rather than waiting for them to come and take it themselves. On the other hand we could simply put down the rebellion, and the upstart Inca Empire itself and be done with it as they most likely incited the rebellion in the first place to further their own aims.
We wish them only the best

Upon the start the Incan Emperor Pachacuti II's reign the Quechua people of Cuzco and Arequipa began agitating to rejoin the Inca Empire. After repeatedly being ignored they have entered into open revolt. As the Incans grow in power and prestige it will become increasingly difficult to hold onto the area as it contains their ancestral capital. It maybe adventagous to transfer the lands peacefully to the Inca, rather than waiting for them to come and take it themselves. On the other hand we could simply put down the rebellion, and the upstart Inca Empire itself and be done with it as they most likely incited the rebellion in the first place to further their own aims.
Allow the savages to Join their beloved "Empire"
We will never allow ourselves to lose land! Fight the savages!

The Panjabis have revolted against our rule and rallied around the late son of Rajit Singh, Dhulip Singh who has entered Lahore in triumph ! We have to act swiftly or our Indian ambitions will end there !

There are rumblings in the international community regarding $COUNTRY$'s warlike demeanor, and some are talking about the need for a united front to contain $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aggression. There are even efforts to stir up our own citizens against us. We will have to be careful in the future, lest we face not a single enemy but that of the world's great powers united against us.

The world's great powers have taken note of $COUNTRY$'s efforts to change our aggressive ways. Some are making overtures to improve relations, and their diplomats are expressing hope that $COUNTRY$ will continue to deal with other countries in a civilized manner.
Thanks for the vote of confidence.
We cannot abide a nation with no respect for civilization.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached our nation with an ultimatum: dimantle $COUNTRY$ immediately, or the great powers of the world will be forced to unite against us. Their demands consist of the following:

1. The return of all unlawfully-held territories gained by conquest.
2. The release of any aspirant peoples currently within our lands.
3. The transfer of all colonies and overseas territories to the other great powers.
4. An agreement by $COUNTRY$ not to declare war on any other nation for a period of no less than ten years.

It goes without saying that these demands are extremely humiliating, and the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people would be justifiably upset should we agree. If we do not, however, $COUNTRY$ will face a great war which even we may not be able to deal with.
We have no choice but to accept.
Shall we join the war against the pariah?

We have received a cable from $FROMCOUNTRY$: they have declared war upon us, and will pursue the war until such a time as $COUNTRY$ is disarmed and submitted to the will of the international community.
We may now lay down our arms.
We are no longer a member of the international coalition.

We have proven that no nation can stand in $COUNTRY$'s way. We will do as we please, and no amount of objection from the so-called great powers of the world will deter us from achieving our destiny. For now there is peace, and if other nations seek to stop us from achieving our future goals, they are welcome to try.

The reeking, putrid stench welling out of the old house smells like mould and rotting timber. There isn't a soul about, save an old drunkard who scurries out through a back-door at the first hint of light shining in through a soot-covered window. God alone knows for how long this house has been standing here, but it's delapitated state paints a clear picture of what our nation has become in the past few decades. Poverty is becoming ever more widespread, and housing like this is standard for far too many of our nation's poor and downtrodden. Infinitely worse: These unsanitary hovels are an ample breeding ground for filth and disease.
I, frankly, do not see the problem.

While there has been ample talk in this chamber about the costs of sickness, illness and disease, I have heard only very little being said on the costs of health care, and even less mention of the costs associated with, specifically, public health care. How many private practices are being forced to close each year, due to public competition? How many apothecaries? How much private initiative is every year smothered on the altar of inefficient government bureaucracy, and how much more will it have to be before our government sets our health care free?'\n\nA counter-reform speech in parliament today has gained public interest, and a surprising amount of people are coming out in opposition to the present health-care system. How should the government react?
Fold completely and revoke the reform

He lives in a house, a very big house, in the country.'\n\nWith our urban centers growing every day from a constant stream of people flowing in from the country side and into the cities, it is no surprise to find at least a small trickle going in the other direction. With living and health conditions in the cities worsening on account of overcrowding, pollution and poor housing, some people, predominantly from the middle classes, have come to yearn again for the peace and quiet of country life, and, with living standards and wages increasing, more and more people can also afford the occasional trip out of town for some rest and recreation in the fresh open air of a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ country side.

Aye, I'd say they fed the pigs better than they ever did us.'\n\nA local scandal coming out of one of our states has garnered a fair amount of national attention during the last few weeks. Apperantly, a foreman at one of the local workhouses has embezzled public funds alloted to him, and recovered the losses by serving poorer quality food, sometimes not more than a few slices of bread each day, to the people employed by the institution. The case has become a soap-box for conservatives and liberals alike, with conservatives arguing against government intervention and liberals arguing the need for more social reforms.

With a weak public opinion in favor of further social reform, some of our citizens in one of our states have taken the matter of caring for the downtrodden into their own hands, forming a 'Society of Friends'. The society is dedicated to carrying out various tasks of social work: food for the elderly, employment and religious education for the poor, and also runs a cooperative poor- and workhouse for these purposes.
That's what I call private initiative!
Why is this on my desk?

Thus, an additional few thousand dead this year can be attributed to the ravages of tuberculosis in our state.'\n\nA local physician's privately published report on the state of health care in his home state has caused a small public uproar in $COUNTRY$. Among general talk of the unsanitary and cramped living conditions that the disease seems to thrive on, the report is also severely critical of the government for not doing more in preventing the spread of tuberculosis by a stricter policy of quarantine, and for not providing adequate facilities for treatment. Conservatives lampoon the report as a hysterical opinion piece, and acting on it might anger them. On the other hand, we could use a sanitarium.
Ignore the report to please conservatives
Seek local funders for a sanitarium

And what now of the government's latest master-stroke? Apparently, if the Minister of Public Health is to be believed, free beds and food is no longer enough of a bribe to all the vagrants of the world. Teeth, gentlemen, are on the agenda!'\n\nThe ruling party has spent some effort trying to pass a Dental Care reform bill, aiming to provide our citizens with some modicum of basic dental health care. Thus far the idea has met with limited success, and there is talk among rank and file party members of abandoning the idea altogether.

Is it, I ask of this government, right, that a man with a life of hard and honest work behind him, should be left without aid or assistance merely on account of the whims of fate?'\n\nA farmer in one of our states has had a near-fatal threshing accident which has left him permanently disabled and disfigured. The case has been brought to the national scene in parliamentary debates over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ pensions system, where reform-minded MPs have used the case as a bat with which to beat the government for not doing more to help the old and disabled.

As our average life expectancies have increased over the years, more and more families have had to take care of their elderly who are no longer able to provide for themselves. The social makeup of our country is changing, and without much in way of a national plan for the elderly and the disabled, a lot are falling between the cracks in the system. Conservatives have by and large taken the stance that the family is the first and last social support structure for the elderly, and that an increasing role for government in the area threatens to unravel important societal bonds. Liberals, on the other hand, see our pensions as tragically lacking, pointing to the many who, seemingly, go without aid.
I belive we must bide our time
On the contrary, we need to reverse direction

I have, in my overview of government policy, been careful not to attribute to malice that which can reasonably be attributed to sheer stupidity. The task has been daunting at times.'\n\nOur pensions system has come under attack by opposition within the ruling party. Aside from various administrative complaints against the system, the focal point of the critique seems to be that the pensions are, quite simply, too low. Some sort of response would be in order.
I agree that certain revisions are in order

Me 'ole lyfe I've been workin' hard, an' what do I get nuw? Gruel.'\n\nThe pensions system has been on everyone's lips and minds the past week, with the publication of a parliamentary report on the pensions system. The report is fairly nuanced in its overall conclusions about the system, but the issue that has stuck with people is an attached case-study interview with an elderly gentleman left out of the pensions system on what seems like mere technicalities, who complains about having worked hard all his life, but now being fed nothing but gruel.
I guess we could use some reforms

Since I was a boy, for all my life, I've marched. Up and down, and back and forth, I've marched with the firm conviction that I would die young, in service of the country that I hold dearer than any other under the sun. Yet, now, when my life draws to more peaceful ends, I cannot help but notice that I am old.'\n\nWhile life expectancies in $COUNTRY$ are decidedly on the increase, the unfortunate interaction between a relatively low wage, and equally low pensions, means that very few people can afford to make preparations for an old age where they are no longer capable of working.
